name: Strip: The teasing dice game
description:
Strip is a dice game aimed at the adult market.
It consists of 6 'boards' each featuring a different lady. Each board has nine flaps that, when turned over, will reveal the lady pictured without clothes on. The illustrations are rather well-done, rather like Pin-ups in the 1950's.
Three dice are rolled and the player first uses one die to choose which lady he 'owns'. The ladies are numbered 1 to 6.
Everybody chooses a lady to represent. Having chosen a lady by using the appropriate die, he uses the other two dice to turn over one or more of her flaps. This is done by using the two individual die numbers to 'open' two flaps or one flap using the total of the two dice.
Further choices are that he may re-clothe his own lady, utilising the dice as described earlier.
If a lady is stripped completely, the 'owner' puts a token representing a life into the 'pot'. If a player loses 3 lives he is out of the game. The winner will be the last player with an unstripped lady.

—user summary

name: Red Prinsessen
description:
In this game the player roll a die to move their knight or one of the monsters around the board. Player cannot cross a space with a monster. If you catch the princess you have to return to your castle to win, if another player catches you while you are carrying the princess, you will be sent home while the other player takes the princess.
—user summary

Save the Princess
Knights and monsters

Scarribly Entertaining
The beautiful princess has been kidnapped by the evil monsters of the forest, and the kingdom is in sorrow and crisis. As a young and talented knight-in-learning it's your job to save the princess and bring her back to your castle.

Can you avoid the monsters and the competing knights and bring the princess back to safety?

Save the Princess is a simple and catching game, built with few and simple rules, and a catching adventurous design, which makes the game fun for both children and childish people.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Red Prinsessen
Riddere og monstre

Uhyggeligt Underholdende
Den smukke prinsesse er blevet kidnappet af skovens onde monstre og det ganske kongerige er nu kastet ud i en stor sorg og krise. Som ung og talentfuld ridder-lærling er din opgave at redde prisessen og bringe hende uskadt tilbage i sikkerhed på dit slot.

Kan du slippe uden om monstrene og de andre rivaliserende riddere og bringe prinsessen tilbage i sikkerhed?

Red Prinsessen er et enkelt og fængende spil, der er bygget op med få og enkle spilleregler og et eventyrligt design, der gør det sjovt for både børn og andre barnlige sjæle.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Lemmify
description:
The aim of the game is to get your family of 3 across the valley of death to the safety of their new home.

To do this you have 2 dice, you can use the number as one whole number for one Lemming or you can split the dice and move two lemmings (sticking to the numbers on the dice please!!) as you move along you must avoid rivers, canyons, forest fires and the ubiquitous Random Encounters which can be good or bad! However, you can navigate the terrain using Save or Play cards specific to each obstacle. For example, rivers can be used as normal squares if you have a boat, Lem Cardashian's floating but, or a Child's birthday balloon. Save or Play cards can also save you from predators such as the Lemming Chainsaw Massacre which prevents you from being eaten by mountain lions, snakes, or being trampled by an angry bull BUT you can only use one card per one lemming (then the card goes back to the bottom of the pack) so use them wisely to get your lemmings to safety.

As you move around the board the risks are greater AND if at any point you land on a space with another teams lemming you must battle it out for territory by rolling one die each, the one with the least has to move back the number they rolled, but beware of landing on Random Encounters and other Lemmings because you must keep going until you are safe.

The game builds in tension as the players begin to reach their new home because you are now in a position where you don’t have the option to choose which lemming you move, beware friends and family as you get closer to winning they might have a mean streak you didn’t know about and use a Save or Play card against another player.

This board game pits you against your family and friends in a fun but strategic game, it’s your job to know which Lemming to move and when to strike in order to get home first. As the game progresses the stakes are higher - Lemmy is counting on you!

-description from designer

name: The Bible
description: Bible trivia game based on the TV miniseries "The Bible"
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Religious, Trivia

name: Prinsessans bal
description:
The box folds out to form the garden board, with a castle backdrop added on one side. Each player/princess moves along their own garden path towards the castle, turning up helping or hindering tokens as they go. Some rolls make you obtain or relinquish the game's one bracelet. You win by reaching the end of your path and also holding the bracelet.

Not to be confused with a different princess-themed set collection game of the same name published earlier by Alga.

—user summary
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Selfie Cards
description:
Every card in Selfie Cards has one real-life achievement that will make your life more fun if you try to achieve it. To play, take two or three cards a week and try to take selfies as specified on them. If you are unable to do it, take another card and put the one you cannot do under the deck.

Compare your results to the list of achievements to see how you stack up!

name: Sularia Protocols (fan expansion for Ophidian 2350 CCG & Battle for Sularia)
description:
This Halloween season two worlds will collide
> The first Ophidian 2350 CCG Fan Made Expansion Set in almost 14 years
> The first Ever Battle for Sularia Fan Made Expansion Set

- - - - -
Welcome to Ophidian 2350: Sularia Protocols
Ophidian 2350: Sularia Protocols is a FREE print-to-play Expansion Set for both Ophidian 2350 CCG and Battle For Sularia card game. Meaning that above you will find:

8 cards fully compatible with Punch-It Entertainment’ Battle for Sularia and Reign of Terror.
8 cards fully compatible with Hack and Slash Games’ Ophidian 2360 and Ophidian 2350 CCG.


—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Field of Victory
description:
Field of Victory is a unique game in so much as it has trimmed off much of that which leads up to a battle and left the battle itself. Rather than maneuvering into an engagement, units maneuver within the engagement. The game makes no attempt to simulate the myriad minutiae of a Napoleonic battle but rather focuses on a compact nucleus of primary details essential to the period. This gives the game flavor without overwhelming the main ingredient, fun.

The battlefield consists of a series of terrain cards upon which either randomly selected or purchased units maneuver and fight.

Commanders may be chosen from a historically rated list or randomly created.

A wide variety of unit types have their own combat ratings that are representative of the parent nation. Stats for France, Britain, Russia, Prussia and Austria are included.

Each game assumes the starting point of 2 armies which have made contact. To win, simply clear the enemy from one of three separate lanes. Numerous modifiers reward support and combined arms among other things.

Combat is based on a 2D10/100 percentile engine that first determines if you hit and then determines the effect which can include: disorder, rout, or elimination.

Optional rules include random events and more.

With less than 6 pages of rules and a readily graspable system, you will be commanding an army in no time!

—description from the publisher

name: Election!
description:
Election! is a game about Australian Federal elections.

Players play as either government or opposition party through a number of days, represented by event cards, of an election campaign. Events give margin points to either party, and the player winning those points can play a strategy card for bonus points, which in turn can be countered by a strategy card played by their opponent. Once all event cards have been evaluated, the player with the most margin points wins the election, and thus the game.

name: Project Mars: Mini Expansion
description:
The Project Mars: 2 Card Mini Expansion.

Included with Spielbox Magazine (English Edition) Issue #7 2018

Also works with Project Mars: Moving Forward expansion.

It consists of the Office Dog card and the Intern card. these get shuffled into the deck during setup.

Office Dog - Place in your tableau. Office Dogs do not require extra Office Space or pay during Pay Day phase (limit 1 per player. Gain 1 Approval.

Intern - Place in your tableau. Interns do not require extra Office Space or pay during Pay Day phase (limit 1 per player. Gain 1 Engineering.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Space Exploration

name: Twisted Vulgarities
description:
Twisted Vulgarities is an intense, painfully funny party game for you and your friends. During each round you will cross the line with dirty phrases and activities that are sure to make you laugh your tail off. Play fast and go “all in” with each Task To Pass Card. Your friends will definitely appreciate the effort. Be careful you might just have the funniest night of your life. This game is completely satire and not intended for the easily offended. It contains coarse sexual content and explicit language. We are not responsible for emotional meltdowns, mental distress caused by your actions, or side splitting pains from laughter. It is required that you have a sense of humor, life experiences, and don’t take life too seriously. Play at your own risk and let your friends see another side of you.

—description from the publisher

name: Till Dice Do Us Part
description:
You and your partner have recently met and are about to go on the romantic journey of a lifetime by building a path toward happily ever after. However, every relationship is filled with good and bad times: arguments, tears, shared success, and smiles. Happily ever after or heartache, see which one the dice of fates has in store for you.

Till Dice Do Us Part is a 2 player game with both a cooperative and competitive mode. You begin on the "meet" hex with your partner and are attempting to reach “happily ever after” by laying journey markers. Along the way, you journey will wind and twist to accomplish 3 or 6 benchmarks. This is done by building your journey though the benchmark icons. Once you have accomplished all the benchmarks, you are ready to get your happily ever after.

Throughout the journey and gameplay, you will encounter life and relationship events that can help you work toward happily ever after or create new obstacles on the path. These can be simple problems (what’s for dinner, total your car, TV betrayal, etc.) or helpful events (get a promotion, perfect present) and some events that can have either good or bad consequences (first kiss, start a new business, etc.) You can also gain virtue cards, which act as permanents giving free foundations, extra abilities, and more. The game is played with a unique dice mechanism. After rolling two die, you may choose to either collect an outcome based off each individual number, or combine the numbers to trigger events.

—description from the designer

name: Night at the Movies: Movie Buffs Games Night
description: A collection of 5 movie trivia themed games including 3D movie charades (wearing 3D glasses, included, participants must guess the “silly situation” being acted out), Higher or Lower (participants challenge their skills by guessing if statistics are high or low), Raise the Stakes (team go head to head answering questions on a specific topic), Three Clues (guess the answer with only 3 clues to help you), and Movie Trivia (a test of participants overall movie trivia knowledge). Popcorn not included.

name: Westbrooke: Out Last – Deluxe Edition
description:
Westbrooke: Out Last is a zombies vs. humans game that pits you against time and each other. Work with your team of fellow survivors to escape the zombie ridden city of Westbrooke before it gets destroyed by a nuclear bomb.

As humans you must move from tile to tile locating objectives, fighting off zombies, and collecting items and weapons. Use the custom dice to fight off zombies. Once you and your teammates have collected the objectives make you must make your way to the exit before the nuke gets dropped.

The opposing zombie team places zombies of all sorts in the path of the humans to try and stop them from reaching the exit. If they are going down they are taking the humans with them.

The Deluxe Edition contains two additional characters — the Priest and the Scout — as well as 18 extra Phase cards (items, weapons, and strategy cards).
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Lobster Claw
description:
A simple, competitive dice party game best for larger groups.

Each turn you roll your dice and depending on the results choose to either add to the lobster which helps you achieve the winning goal of getting rid of all your dice or create a claw to cut the lobster which lets you hand out the severed dice to your opponents pushing them further away from winning.

—description from the designer

name: Dragon Pets: Promo Cards
description:
Two cards published when this game was released by Japanime Games.

Both of these cards just add to the variety of eggs in the base game. Both are worth two coins.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: Raging Bull Rodeo
description: Slide the switch to the left and take it in turns to load up the bull, by positioning accessories strategically as you don't want them to fall off. Flick the switch and watch Bronco Bill try and stay on. Count how many accessories have stayed on the raging bull and the player with the most left wins! Contents include: Raging bull, Bronco Bill, saddle, 12 x hook on accessories and stickers.

name: Yas Queen!
description:
Yas Queen is a quick, fun game where you are as a Drag Superstar looking to plan your weekend performances. The game is played in 3 rounds - Friday Night, Saturday Night, and Sunday Brunch. Each round presents players with a number of venues, where they must assemble their fellow queens to perform at.

Not all venues are equal, though. Some (such as the the Retirement Center) want Queens who can sing Broadway classics, while others (such as the Nightclub) want Queens who can dance. Each Queen specializes in a different talent, so you must be strategic about who you send where.

But watch out! Player interaction becomes paramount as your opponents "Throw Shade" (by literally throwing cards at you) and try to ruin your performances! Will you can overcome that by "Spilling the T."

Yas Queen is a quick, lighthearted game that will have everyone yelling "YASSS QUEEN!"

—description from the publisher

name: Tourni Badou
description:
Do you have an elephant's memory? Test your memory with Tourni Badou! Make Badou turn and follow his instructions carefully: "A card!", Two cards!" or "Close your eyes!". Each turn players turn one or two cards. The first who collects all the cards corresponding to his character is the winner!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Go F**k Yourself!
description:
An offensive and immature party game for adults who hate each other.

The aim of Go F**k Yourself! is to collect as many full sets (four of a kind) as possible. There are thirteen different sets in the deck and the player with the most at the end is the winner.

Shuffle the deck and deal five cards to each player and place the remaining deck in the centre of the table. Player 1 (Joe) can only asks for cards in his hand and asks Player 2; "Mary, have you got... A huge dick but no hands?" If Mary has one or more of this card she must hand them all over to Joe. He can now ask Mary for a different card or any other player for the same or a different card from his hand. When a player does not have the card asked for they reply; "Go F**k Yourself!" Joe must then take one card from the top of the deck and play continues clockwise. When a player completes a full set of cards they must place them on the table in front of them. Note: If a players hand becomes empty at any point they must take one new card from the deck.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Stations
description:
Deliver your customers to stations situated all across town, and be the first to get them to each before your competition in this latest title from famed game designer, Reiner Knizia.

In Stations, players will compete to be the first to visit seven stations, represented by colored discs on both the board and in front of them. The first player to get rid of all their discs wins. On the way, they collect tickets to help them maneuver around the board, hop off one transport and make their way to the next transport that will take them where they need to go. But watch out! If you're waiting at the station hoping to hop on the next "shuttle", the transport might just pass you by!

Stations is part of the Age Fluid series of games with gameplay that is, at once, perfect for entire families and can be built up to appeal to the more serious gamer. The game comes with the base rules and variants designed to make the strategy ramp up.

name: Ars Roma: Volume 1 – Rape of the Sabine Women
description:
In Volume 1 of Ars Roma you are playing the role of an Ancient Roman family trying to secure the best marriages for the advancement of your career and gene pool.

It is a card game (48 cards) and accommodates between two to eight players.

Play is simple hand management and card play that tries to raid and secure women from four tribes of Rome.

Self published and basic production values.

—user summary

name: INTERACTION: No more boredom! – Soccer Expansion
description: Soccer Expansion extends Interaction base game with additional 400 questions and tasks with topic soccer.
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Set Collection

name: Jokimatka
description:
In this game players compete to be the first to sale through a river.

Sailing is done one at the time by trying to trace the river with a stick while blindfolded. The players turn continues until one hits a shore or gets in to the goal. If a player hits shore, others will shout stop. The player puts his marker on that spot. When it's the players next turn the player will continue from that spot.

There are some places on the board which when hit will force the player to skip a turn or two

—user summary

name: Battling Star-Ships
description:
"Starships battle for the survival of the universe!"

In this dexterity game, two players sit on opposite sides of a large "space wheel". The space wheel is spun with two starship pucks on it. The players control sliding "command modules" and try to keep the starship of their color in play while allowing the opposing starship to fall off.

name: Stora Racerspelet
description:
This auto racing game is one of several sports-themed games published by Klee and/or Spika in Sportmagazin compilations and then sold separately in Sweden. It may be from the 60s or early 70s.

Although the game is basically a normal roll-and-move game with event spaces, there are a few things setting it apart. First, instead of racing from start to goal, you go around a circuit five times. Second, two dice are used to move. Third, there is player elimination, but players can only be eliminated in pairs, meaning the effect on the outcome is quite different depending on whether the player count is 2 (game ends), 3 (remaining player wins) or 4 (remaining players continue and may or may not also be eliminated).

—user summary
mechanics: Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Trivia Box: Family Guy
description:
So you think you know family Guy? Includes 20 character cards. Hundreds of trivia questions. Braggin' rights with every win!

—description from the publisher

name: Sweet Mess: The Judges Table Expansion
description:
Your dessert creations and your efforts in the kitchen are now being judged! The Judges Table Expansion brings new scoring elements to the game with open and secret goals.

Play with the three open goals decks to give all players a chance to score additional endgame points by completing objectives in three categories; Set Goals, Mastery Goals, and Baking Bonus Goals. The judges will award points based on how well players do in these categories!

Play with the secret goals deck(s) to give each player chances to individually score endgame points by completing personal objectives. The judges will challenge you in certain areas of the competition and award points for success!

Play with one or both of these goals systems! There will also be alternative variant play with this expansion for greater replay value.

—decription from the publisher

name: Sweet Mess: Christmas Gifts & Goodies Expansion
description:
It's that wonderful time of year when the tastiest desserts are being baked! The Christmas Gifts & Goodies Expansion adds themed Recipe and Event Cards to the game of Sweet Mess, as well as new gameplay rules.

These special desserts require the Super-ingredient (wild), but give a special bonus when baked. Introducing the Mastery Die, this expansion gives you another way to score Cooking Points. After a Christmas dessert is baked, roll the Mastery die and collect a Mastery Token that matches the result. You will score 1 point for every collected Mastery Token that matches a mastery icon on a scored Recipe Cards!

This fun twist on Ingredient Masteries adds more life to the game and is an optional module that can be included or excluded from play.

—decription from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Sweet Mess: Halloween Trick or Treats Expansion
description:
Trick or treat? Why not both?! With themed Recipe and Event cards, as well as new gameplay rules, the Halloween Trick or Treats Expansion will surely sweeten your plays of Sweet Mess!

These spooktacular desserts, when baked, will provide you with a Trick or Treat Token. These tokens can be saved and if you get a set, you will be treated with endgame points. Or you can trick another chef out of an ingredient of your choosing, but you have to give them the Trick or Trick Token in return. They of course can work toward sets or, in turn, use it on another chef!

Choose to play with this optional module, but be careful. Some chefs just may be out to get you. Muahahahahaaa!

—decription from the publisher

name: Sweet Mess: Cater Challenge
description: A kickstarter exclusive expansion that adds 5th player and two versions of co-op mode.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Set Collection

name: OpozO: Amazing OBOTs – Game Player
description:
OpozO BOTs, OBOTs, are amazing because they are Big On Thinking smart. They are ideal for children of 7+ who want to learn about our world creating and playing games in ways they want to learn – by having fun.

Amazing OBOTs are ways to play that adults can enjoy too as they introduce very different ways to play you might not normally associate with Strategy Board Games.

Lazy Bug Race – where you race to carry your lazy bug to a new garden but watch out for rival OBOTs. Game centres upon carrying something and using strength (OpozO Push Move) to manoeuvre your way past your opponents.

Stone Bash – heavy stones and rival OBOTs are in your way as you try to get home first. Use the weight of stones and combine your strengths to thwart your opponent.

Once you get to grips with these two ways to play, why not mix up the games to include some Stones in your Lazy Bug games!

OBOTs play can include opponent OBOTs tile elimination or not – always your choice.

—description from the publisher

name: Junktech: Duel
description:
The selfishness of humankind has turned the planet into a giant junkyard. Fight to Survive!

In Junktech: Duel players must use their reflexes, perceptiveness, strategic thinking as well as their character’s unique abilities to win. By combining all of these elements we have created an innovative mechanic that allows the card game to simulate real combat. Junktech: Duel is a game of simple rules, high replayability and frantic combinations in every turn. Manage your cards and resources wisely!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Fighting, Real-time
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Push Your Luck, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Blue Metal: Tactical Racing
description:
A race to the finish. Players control their speed by switching between High and Low Gears, drifting around corners, and trying to predict the potential layout of the race track. Every time you move off a Track Card your opponent plays one from their hand, continuing the track until they run out of Track Cards. Once you move off the last Track Card and your opponent has no more left to play, you win.

—description from the designer
categories: Print & Play, Racing, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Master of Code
description:
Master of Code is a print & play game of number logic and deduction for 2-4 players.

The goal is to be the first to figure out what 6 digit code the other players have. You do this by asking questions regarding sums, differences and position of the numbers. However, the opponents can also block you from asking a specific question if they feel it gives away too much information or perhaps want to bluff you.

But be careful, if you guess wrong you will not know which code you got wrong and have to stay out for a couple of rounds.

—description from the publisher

name: Hands Down this game Will Spill The Beans on the origins of expressions
description:
Players receive a common everyday phrase from the judge, such as "Shoot the Moon," and write a story explaining the phrase's origin. If you are the closest to the correct origin as determined by the judge, you gain 2 points. The judge may also award 1 point to the funniest or most creative origin.

—user summary

name: Solvalla-travet
description:
This is an extremely basic horse racing-themed betting game. It is named for the Solvalla racetrack in Stockholm and has no relation to later games using the name.

Players bet on one of six colours, the exact means of which are not specified or provided. A roulette wheel is then spun, assigning a number and thereby a relative position to each colour. Depending on the bets made and betting scheme agreed on beforehand (win or place), payments are made. You can then presumably continue in the same way for as long as you desire.

Probably sold in the 1940s or 1950s.

—user summary

name: Resa genom Sverige
description:
Resa genom Sverige is a roll-and-move game themed as a journey through Sweden. It is clearly an adaptation of Reise durch Nord- und Mitteldeutschland from the same publisher, which is estimated to have been published in the 1950s.

As in its German counterpart, there are two sides to the board, showing northern and southern Sweden, each one a separate game. When landing on town spaces, players read interesting facts from separate sheets, then follow instructions in the rules. These include the old standbys of losing a turn or moving a number of spaces forward or back, but also instructions to pay coins (which presumably have been distributed before the game) to a pot.

There is a reference to dividing this pot after finishing the game, but the actual specifications are missing. (In the German game first place gets half, second place gets a third, third place gets the remainder.) Also, as in the German game, there's no special significance given to the result.

—user summary
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Problem Picnic: Attack of the Ants – T(ant)rum Promo
description:
T(ant)rum is a promo round card that was originally created for the Tantrum House Season 4 Kickstarter campaign.

The card has the following ability:
"When you get this card, take any Round card that was not in the game or that has already been used and discarded. Keep it as if you'd drawn that one instead of this one, and discard this one."
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Take That

name: Think Quick
description:
The Fast and Frenzied Word Game!

Name two objects beginning with "A" that will fit inside a matchbox? Easy?? Well think again!! All you've got is ten nerve racking seconds.

Your opponents will shout, they will sing, even scream; in fact they will try almost anything to divert your attention away from the subject and that much needed letter!

As the noise reaches fever pitch, and the clickity-clack of the ball rolling through the timer suddenly ceases, the unthinkable becomes reality, and you're - OUT OF TIME!

Beat the timer and your opponents in this fast and frenzied word game in which only the calm can survive to compose a winning five letter word.

name: Världen runt
description:
Världen runt ("Around the world") is a simple roll-and-move game themed as a trip around the world by boat, train and plane. There are event spaces where you lose turns, take alternate routes and such, but no player decisions.

There is very little information attached. The inclusion on the cover of what appears to be a converted B-24 Liberator may date the game to the late 1940s; illustrator ollejoh is known to have provided art for another game dated to 1948. The bottom of the box is stamped with "X29", but the significance of this is unknown.

—user summary
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rocket Drop
description:
This marble drop game contains small plastic balls rather than real marbles.

Each player removes a stick and tries not to let any of the balls drop. The player with the least balls at the end of the game wins.

name: Sushi War: Laser Battle
description:
In the near future, an Alien Race formed by Sushi is conquering the entire world.
But when everything seemed to be lost, 4 Legendary Chef Warriors came from the future to avoid the World destruction.
Each Chef Warrior wants to prove his worth and they will compete between each other to be the first to safe the World.
Be ready for the various challenges in the game and use Laser Chopsticks as a tremendous force to reach your purposes.

An incredible battle with chopsticks, sushi dice and a bit of intriguing tech! Easy to learn and to explain, Sushi War: Laser Battle is more than a simple dexterity game! Discover an innovative way to play! Use your chopsticks to build real Sushi Towers and defeat your opponents throwing down their compositions!

Join an unique Arena using Laser Chopsticks of different colors: only with them you can destroy the Sushi menace!

Main features of the game:


Build Sushi Towers with the correct dice sides up as fast as you can to earn points.
Throw dice against your opponents to destroy their towers and win easier.
Change game modes with exclusive challenges and prove your talent with chopsticks.
Switch on the Laser Chopsticks and eliminate the Sushi race from the Arena!


—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Humor, Party Game, Real-time, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Jurassic World Miniature Game: Fallen Kingdom Expansion
description:
Adds Claire Dearing & Owen Grady as playable characters.

Adds Blue & the Indoraptor as playable dinosaurs.
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Phase Order

name: Stray Cats: Housing a Pet
description:
This is an expansion pack for StrayCats. You would need the Stray Cats or Stray Dog deck to play this. The game will completely change. Without using any chosen house and Paw Law, the game is to collect animals inside houses. However, you must pair certain animals together to get higher victory points.

-description from designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Stray Cats: Holiday Surprise
description:
This is an expansion deck for StrayCats card game. To play this game, you will need to have the StrayCats/StrayDogs deck.

-Place the Holiday Surprise deck next to the StrayCat draw deck.
-Play the StrayCats game in the same old way.
-Gain a Holiday Suprise card every time you play a CAT CARD.
-Collect all the surprises for a bigger surprise.

-description from designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Lovelace & Babbage: Game Boy Geek Season 7 Patron Card
description:
Available from the Game Boy Geek Season 7 Kickstarter campaign.

An additional patron card for the game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Number, Real-time
mechanics: Action Queue, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Spell Clash
description:
Two players represent wizard apprentices who have recovered 18 scrolls of parchment from an ancient tome. Along the edges of each scroll are engraved runes of power. Players will arrange scrolls from their hands such that runes align to form powerful incantations, which will score them prestige and, depending on the color and arrangement of the runes, grant them special magical abilities as well. The object for each apprentice is to demonstrate superior mastery of the arcane scrolls and thus prove their mettle as the most accomplished wizard.

This game was developed as an entry for the ButtonShy September 2019 game design challenge- the restriction was that each of the 18 cards must be identical to one another.

—description from the designer

name: Cards Against Health IT
description:
To start the game, each player draws five white cards.

The player who has most recently logged into an EHR goes first. The player flips over a green card and reads the question or phrase aloud.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Classic Air Racing: Thompson Trophy Air Racing 1930-1939
description:
Air racing in the 1930s was a very popular spectator sport with excitement, drama, danger, and a huge fan base following the exploits of those intrepid aviators! The art and science of aviation advanced rapidly in those early days of aviation, and hundreds of thousands of spectators came out to the races to see their stars in action! The Thompson Trophy races at the National Air Races events were the premiere closed-course pylon racing events in the nation during the 1930s. It was the Indianapolis 500 of air racing, drawing hundreds of thousands of fans to watch the best air racers of the era put their planes through the paces.

Classic Air Racing: Thompson Trophy Air Racing 1930-1939 can take you back to the thrilling sport of 1930s air racing!! This game is a table top, performance-based simulation of Thompson Trophy air racing in the 1930s. The game is based on the historical performance of each pilot and plane that flew in the 10 Thompson Trophy races from 1930 through 1939. Rules and procedures provide a simulation of flying around the closed pylon courses that were used in these races.

The game document in the Files section includes historical background on the Thompson Trophy series, rules and procedures for performing the races, performance values for each pilot and plane in each race, graphic images of planes that flew in the historical races that are used as counters for game play, map sheets with hex grids that reflect the various closed courses used in the series of races, counters and markers for keeping track of each competitor’s race status, and Plane Control Panels for each plane in the race.

Game components can be printed from the game document, and instructions are provided for assembling the map sheets to provide the courses used for each race in the series. Everything needed to play the game is included in the game document in the files section, except for two ten-sided dice.

—description from the designer

name: Rising Darkness
description:
Semi-cooperative card game in which up to four players put themselves in the shoes of some students who, attacked in the forest by a group of strange creatures, manage to lock themselves in a shabby wooden house. Help is on its way, but the creatures are increasingly more and the walls will not resist much more.

One of the players will take the role of the group of creatures that, as if it were a hive mind, will make strategic decisions to try to open a gap through which to access the interior of the cabin and ending their prey. If he succeeds, they will have gained the forces of darkness. If the students resist the number of shifts necessary for rescuers to arrive, everything will have been in a tremendous fright, and the young people will have won.
Semi-cooperative card game in which up to four players put themselves in the shoes of some students who, attacked in the forest by a group of strange creatures, manage to lock themselves in a shabby wooden house. Help is on its way, but the creatures are increasingly more and the walls will not resist much more.

One of the players will take the role of the group of creatures that, as if it were a hive mind, will make strategic decisions to try to open a gap through which to access the interior of the cabin and ending their prey. If he succeeds, they will have gained the forces of darkness. If the students resist the number of shifts necessary for rescuers to arrive, everything will have been in a tremendous fright, and the young people will have won.
—description from the designer
Juego de cartas semi-cooperativo en el que hasta cuatro jugadores se ponen en la piel de unos estudiantes que, atacados en el bosque por un grupo de extrañas criaturas, consiguen encerrarse en una destartalada casa de madera. La ayuda viene en camino, pero las criaturas cada vez son más y las paredes no resistirán mucho más.

Un jugador tomará el papel del grupo de criaturas que, como si de una mente-colmena se tratase, tomarán decisiones estratégicas para intentar abrir una brecha por la que acceder al interior de la cabaña y dar buena cuenta de sus presas. Si lo consigue, habrán ganado las fuerzas de la oscuridad. Si los estudiantes resisten el número de turnos necesario para que lleguen los rescatadores, todo habrá quedado en un tremendo susto, y los jóvenes habrán vencido.
—description from the designer (Spanish)
mechanics: Semi-Cooperative Game, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – The Woman Who Lived
description: This expansion adds three versions of Ashildr to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes three miniatures, three faction cards, and one new adventure card to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: アニマルウォーズ (ANIMAL WARS)
description:
アニマルウォーズ (Animaru Wo-zu) ANIMAL WARS is a 2-player card game with a theme of animal survival.

There are 18 animal cards in this game, each of which has its own strength and special power. Players take four cards at beginning of the game.

Each round, players place their first cards in front of them, then reveal them. Then do the same for the second card.

Then players take turns choosing to play an additional card or not. This round ends when all players pass in a row.

Each time a card is revealed, if the card has 'When revealed' effect, resolve it immediately. Some cards have continuous effect which is active while revealed.

At the end of the round, you win a round if your total strength is greater than your opponent's. You score two victory points by winning the round. Some cards give you extra points if they survived the round.

The game ends when a player has accumulated five victory points. The highest scorer wins the game.
user summary

アニマルウォーズはシンプルなカード構成だけど、本格トリックテイキングのゲームです。
手札を順番にプレイし、相手を圧倒させることがポイントです。
カードには強弱がありますが、使い時や組み合わせによって逆転可能です。
「切り札」の出し時を考察するジレンマを楽しめます。
publisher's summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Pequenas Igrejas, Grandes Negócios: Satanistas de Orkutbook
description:
They are everywhere! The Devil in person can be used in this supplement, which consists of tricks and traps of the recesses of Cramunhão!

Adds 30 new cards to the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Pequenas Igrejas, Grandes Negócios: Vodu é pra Jacu
description:
Face the Backrests, the Backstops, the macumbas and exorcise the Crammunion in person! Fight the fire puppies! Do an exorcism at dawn! Go down to hell fifteen times! Try to guess who has epilepsy and who has the devil in the body as you slap them! Bring the loved one in three business days in the name of Jezuis!

Adds 30 new cards to the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: 5150: Fighter Command – Carrier Command
description:
5150: Carrier Command can be played in a variety of ways:

You can play as the Commander of a Star Carrier with flights of Fighters/Bombers.

You can play as the Commander of one Capital Ship chosen from over a dozen types and a variety of Races.

You can play one-off battles.

You can play the full campaign with up to fifteen scenarios.

Inside you’ll find:
Detailed yet simple rules for CapShip combat with stats and counters for a variety of Races and types.

Fifteen scenarios linked together in order to tell your story as the Commander of the Star Carrier Daedalus.

A minimal bookkeeping Campaign System that gives meaning to every game as the results of one will affect the outcome of the next.

A copy of 5150: Fighter Command is required.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Split's grosse Reise
description:
Gather 6 resources with the squirrel themed standees. Use cards as your defined actions and be the first to enter the "Minor castle".
Each player is provided 4 cards with different actions (e.g. move 4 or steal a resource) and has to exactly reach 6 defined spaces on a map to gather the respective resource. If all are gathered, the player has to exactly reach the goal.
After all 4 cards have been played, new 4 cards are dealt and the next player clockwise will start the next round of performing actions.

name: The Apprentice
description:
A tie-in to the UK version of the popular reality game show.

Have you got what it takes to be The Apprentice ? Pit your business wits against other budding tycoons in this competitive board game. You'll need entrepreneurial flair, drive and luck to outsmart your rival candidates as you battle your way to the top. On your way collect deal cards, notch up sales and win clients as you navigate around London's landmarks. Lightweights needn't apply: Only two words stand between you and your dream job - you're hired ... or fired !
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement

name: Gang Wars: An Unofficial FiveCore Supplement
description:
Gang Wars

If you saw the firefight mid-way through Michael Mann's blockbuster Heat and thought; “I bet that'd be cool in miniature.” Then this is the supplement for you. It takes the incredibly versatile FiveCore system and shapes it into a more focussed package.
Most of this supplement is focussed around extended narrative campaigns unfolding over a few missions, but the scenarios can be played standalone as pick-up games.

This supplement requires a copy of FiveCore 2nd edition to use

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Mafia, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Wolfheze
description:
The game is named after Wolfheze, a village in the Netherlands. A part of Operation Market Garden happened in this area.

It consists of a game board printed on thin cardboard. In addition, players need 2d6, paper and pencil, and some markers and playing pieces.
On a turn, a player can choose between rolling the dice and flying. When rolling the dice, the player places a playing piece on a field marked with the resulting number. If that field is occupied, the current piece can be moved to an adjacent field.
Instead of rolling the dice, a player can decide to fly, taking one of their stones off the board and placing it on any free field.
When a vertical column is completely full, the player with most pieces in that column scores points. When a player has placed all their pieces on the board, there is a scoring round, and pieces on certain fields score positive (village fields) or negative (war fields) points. After the second such scoring round, the game ends and the player with most points is the winner.

name: XXXopoly Pride
description:
XXXopoly Pride is an erotic game to be enjoyed by gay and lesbian intimate couples or groups. Explore each other in ways that you have never dreampt possible. XXXopoly Pride will bring everyone closer together, both literally and figuratively.

The board is divided into four sections. You keep moving around the board trying to purchase as many Sexual Spaces as you can. If you land on a Sexual Space that is owned by someone else you must perform what is on the space. Each space constitutes a sexual action ranging from a kiss all the way up to having intercourse for short periods of time. There are many other erotic activities such as massaging, licking, sucking, and more! Bankrupt your partners to win.

XXXopoly Pride is more special because there are two games in one! It all depends on what you like and which side you prefer! On the blue side, experience the hottest, most erotic gay game ever made. Flip it over and experience the hottest, most sensuous, lesbian game every created. XXXopoly pride has it all!

—description from the game box
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Supremacy 2020: Bombers&SLBMs
description:
Fill out your nuclear triad with this all new expansion. The enemy´ s SLMBs can strike with enough speed and surprise to destroy your ICBMs in their silos!

Don‘t worry. Your bombers can deliver your revenge from the grave but only if they can get through the enemy‘s fighter screens.

With the right combination, nuclear war can be winnable.

—description from the publisher
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Chit-Pull System, Commodity Speculation, Trading

name: Le jeu du Super Emmerdeur
description:
Le jeu du Super Emmerdeur
A French party game where you help or make the life of your neighbor miserable.
To win you need not be the first to collect 7 cards Emmerdes (hassle) cards.

Le jeu du Super Emmerdeur
Le premier qui se fait pourrir sa semaine a perdu... Ne vous laissez pas emmerder !

Un jeu de bluff dans lequel vous pouvez emmerder ou aider votre voisin, et réciproquement !
Faites lui des crasses ou tendez lui la main… À lui de juger ce que vous avez derrière la tête.
Le but du jeu : éviter de ramasser 7 cartes Emmerdes, sinon vous perdez.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Humor, Party Game

name: Sweet Mess: Chef Promo 2
description:
Originally available through the 2019 Promo Paradise Kickstarter.

Set includes a chef standee with Lizzy and Derek Funkhouser on opposite sides and the corresponding 3 chef cards (Signature dish, Male Chef, Female Chef).

During setup add this character to the available choices.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Modular Board, Set Collection

name: Micron
description:
Micron is a novel game based on microbial ecology concepts.
At the beginning, players create a board randomly picking hexagonal tiles, each representing a specific marine habitat; every habitat is characterized by specific and different conditions in terms of, for instance, temperature and light, which can be exploited by players. In fact, each player must manage a microbial species, and make it thrive and multiply across the board colonizing habitats that can sustain its metabolism.
Every species is characterized by a metabolism, a way in which it grows and multiplies. Metabolic features are chosen from a set of "plasmids," cards that are picked by players at the beginning of the game from a starting deck. Plasmids belong to different groups, and choosing different sets of plasmids can yield different gaming experiences.
During their turn, players can choose to spend energy for growth, to move, evolve or attack species living in nearby habitats. Since the goal of the game is to colonize the highest number of habitats, each player can tailor his/her strategy according to the special characteristics of his/her microbe.
A player is declared winning when either is the only one left alone on the board or when he/she has colonized the highest number of habitats.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Resource to Move, Simulation

name: Lanterns on the Dock
description:
Dear Detective,
If you are receiving this letter, it is because I am dead. Dark forces beyond anything you can imagine have converged upon me and taken my life from me... or perhaps something worse.
I have seen horrors beyond what the normal human mind can comprehend. Ocean waves that seem to have a life of their own, men with the face of a fish, and a looming figure over the sea--waiting just beyond some unseen veil to come into our world.
It has taken all of my willpower simply not to go insane.
I’ve been investigating a strange underground society in the seaside town of Innsmouth. They claim to be a society, a social club, but I know for a fact they are a cult--a cult hellbent on bringing doom to our world. This is the very thing I was trying to prevent.
Now... it is up to you to stop them once and for all.
I have suspicions that the majority of their activities are taking place at the Innsmouth Docks. I fear that they may be getting close, close to unleashing some sort of dark ritual on our world.
Go to the docks. Pick up where I left off. And pray that God is with you.
Sincerely,
A Friend

P.S. For heaven sake, keep those damn lanterns lit!

Lanterns on the Dock is a Roll+Write role-playing game of Horror Investigation set in 1920s New England. You, the detective/investigator, are following the pleas of a dead friend to check out the docks in the town of Innsmouth. It is there you will find the horrors you need to face.

— description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Deduction, Dice, Horror, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing

name: The COVID Containment
description:
The COVID Containment is a free PNP Solo roll and write game designed by Franz Dias.

In this solo RPG adventure, you are part of a team of medical and government officers tasked with controlling the spread of the Coronavirus in your country. You have at your disposal a finite number of Test Kits and Quarantine facilities. You also have the power to influence government policies.

The game has two key phases

Stock up your medical kit
Take on the COVID 19 virus by rolling your dice!


Defeat the virus by completing the 10 stages and finding a cure!

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Environmental, Medical, Print & Play
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Role Playing

name: Modern Equipment Handbook: Part Two – Equipment specifications for Artillery, Rocket Launchers, Mortars, and Infantry Weapons for Challenger 2000 rules
description:
'Modern Equipment Handbook: Part Two - Equipment specifications for Artillery, Rocket Launchers, Mortars, and Infantry Weapons for Challenger 2000 rules

Contain details on: Arty, Mortars, AA Guns, SAMs, Helicopters, etc.

The equipment specifications are listed by country in alphabetical order.

- user description
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Trick‘n Trouble: Käsekuchen ohne Rosinen promo card
description:
Cheescake without raisins Promo card from Spiel 2018.

Promo task 0/1/4

Simply add this card to the other cards in Trick ‘n Trouble. It just expands the number of available tasks.

name: Classic Quest
description:
Classic Quest is a cooperative game where a group of Heroes faces a fearsome dungeon randomly generated. It is designed so that novice players can get started with this game, but it develops a progressive difficulty that is challenging even for the most experienced ones.

It is a very old-school flavour designed, intended to transport us to the classic adventure that we could enjoy in our favorite fantasy novels or the best role-playing games.

Cooperation between players will always be key to succeed.

The dungeon map will be generated randomly, changing in every game, which favors replayability. The game will have an important number of furniture elements that will help you to dive into the adventur. Dungeon monsters will play automatically according to a protocol, easy to apply and consistent.

The exploration and combat mechanics are developed in a fluid and funny way. Our goal is that you will want to play Classic Quest over and over. No forgotten games on dusty shelves!

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Tile Placement

name: SkirmishCampaigns: Russia '41 – Drive on Minsk
description:
SkirmishCampaigns: Russia '41-Drive on Minsk is a complete book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on the German invasion of Russia in late June 1941.

The book includes ten action-packed scenarios that can be played alone or together in one of three campaigns.

Maximum Replayability: the SkirmishCampaigns system features a realistic (and historic) variable order of battle for each scenario, guaranteeing countless unique scenario and campaign replays.

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Historical Research: this book includes several introduction sections that contain background information on the Russian Campaign of 1941.

Includes:

10 Scenarios,
3 Campaigns


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: The Art of War: The Card Game
description:
Just like the name suggests, The Art of War pays homage to the legendary treatise by Sun Zi, in how it attempts to capture and emulate its essence of extolling the depth of strategy and tactics in actual warfare, within a medieval-fantasy setting.

The objective of the game is won threefold, to either destroy all 7 Resource Areas of the opponent, to defeat the rival Lord, or should one side draw finish his deck, the player with the least amount of damaged Resource Areas wins. Should there be a tie even then, the total damage done to Resource Areas is computed, and the one with lesser damage taken is the winner.

As of the base game, there are currently four Factions, with four more to be added in sequences of two. The first four are Humankind, Elfkind, Demonkind and Orckind.

Each plays with separate themes and mechanics, with the Humans boasting strong defences and economy, the Demons formidable in all facets and arenas, except perhaps at ranged, the Elves being naturally fast and good at ranged combat, and the Orcs are brutal savages in close combat, with the ability to generate a psychic gestalt from their collective energy.

In the first expansion, we will introduce the Slannikind and Rhudkind races, with the Slannikind being the Fantasy archetype for Lizardmen, and the Rhudkind the archetype for Ratmen.

After that, in the second expansion, we will introduce the Dwarfkind forces, together with the Undeadkind, rounding off the game's eight Factions.

The game is played on two playmats, with each Faction having their own playmats, and through the throwing of dice. It is divided into two rows for each side, with the row closer to you being the Resource Line, and the one further, and closer to the Enemy's own playmat, being the Battle Line. Players have to place their Units down on either their Resource or Battle Lines, but not in the opposing force's, unless otherwise stated by a special rule.

Every Faction has a Lord Card in your Hand, which is a superpowered Unit that if defeated, leads to the destruction of your army. Every Unit has six Stats, Cost, Attack, Defence, Health, Initiative and Leadership. To resolve combat and other actions in this game, you will need to roll dice, usually three times, first for Engagement, to see who attacks first, second to see the damage done for the side that attacks first, then to see the damage done by the defending party. If this is insufficient to decide who wins the combat, the losing side has to roll a Morale Check with their Leadership roll. That is in essence the game, although there are other aspects not covered like Spellcasting Magic, Flying and Mounted.

—description from the designer
categories: Civil War, Dice, Economic, Fantasy, Math, Medieval, Memory, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Memory, Movement Points, Player Elimination, Re-rolling and Locking, Square Grid, Stat Check Resolution, Take That, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Player Powers, Zone of Control

name: Super Dungeon: Masterclass – Gork the Hearthsworn Fighter
description:
This Limited Edition Gork the Hearthsworn Fighter Masterclass Miniature features Gork the Hearthsworn Fighter, the hero of the Super Dungeon Novel, The Dungeons of Arcadia.

Resilient and unflinching in the face of combat, the Hearthsworn Dwarves are warriors without peer. Able to withstand injury that would fell any of the lesser races, the Hearthsworn cleave through their adversaries bellowing insults and challenges to any foolish enough to face them.

CONTENTS:
1x Gork the Hearthsworn Fighter Masterclass Miniature
1x Gork the Hearthsworn Fighter Hero Card
1x 25mm Black Base

Take your Super Dungeon hobby to the next level with Super Dungeon: Masterclass! This premium line of resin models is specifically designed for hobby enthusiasts and gamers alike! Featuring Heroes and monsters from throughout the realms of Crystalia, these finely detailed miniatures bring the world of Super Dungeon to life as never before. Each Masterclass miniature includes cards that allow it to be used in your games of Super Dungeon!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: That's So Gay!
description:
The phrase “That’s so gay!” has been used mostly in a negative context for decades. Some people use it as a way to attack or vilify us, and others use it in fun, not realizing the damage it can do. As with the reclaiming of negative words and phrases such as “queer,” this game seeks to turn “That’s so gay!” into a positive opportunity to educate LGBTQs and our allies, and even those people who would attack us. Words can be a tool of our enemies, or can empower us in our work. And this game hopes to break down stereotypes while having some fun with our LGBTQ history. There are the well-known celebrities and media sensations, but also obscure authors, scientists, athletes and pioneers. The scope of the game goes back thousands of years and across multiple continents, all with more than 2,400 questions that will tease you, taunt you, and treat you to some amazing facts. This game would be the most enjoyable for adults and for children ages 12 and up. It is best played in teams, but even two players can have fun testing their knowledge. There are all ranges of questions, so even those who think they “know it all” about the LGBTQ community will undoubtedly sometimes find themselves stumped. This game was created and produced by Tracy Baim, co-founder and publisher of Windy City Times, an LGBTQ newspaper founded in 1985. She has been volunteering and working in the LGBTQ community since 1984.

—description from the publisher

name: Die lustige Paddlerfahrt
description:
The players have to paddle their canoes from space 1 to space 50. Movement is determined by one die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first to reach space 50 wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: A. Anton & Co., Leipzig, Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

name: Vinopolis
description:
Vinopolis is a game where you test your knowledge about the world of wine.

How does it work? Four professions related to wine are represented: the oenologist, the sommelier, the wine merchant, the winemaker. For each of these professions there will be questions with specific mechanics: true/false, numerical estimation within a range, positioning on a world map, multiple choice questions).

When it is the player's turn, he moves the pawn (in the shape of a bottle) to the trade of his choice, provided it is different from the previous turn, and draws a question corresponding to his neighbour. Before he answers, players can bet on his answer (success or failure) to try to win points.
If the person answers the question correctly, they win as many points as indicated on the card (depending on the difficulty of the question). If they answer incorrectly, they still win a chance card (which keeps the game balanced).
The round then moves on to the next player.

"End-of-game" cards are placed in the 5 decks of cards (1 deck "chance", 4 "questions" packages: one per job). When 3 "end-of-game" cards are revealed, the game ends and the player with the most points wins the game.

—user summary

Affrontez-vous pour vous constituer la plus belle Cave en gagnant des Pions. Pariez et répondez aux questions de 4 personnages exerçant un métier lié au vin : le Vigneron, l'Oenologue, le Caviste et le Sommelier. Bluffez sur vos connaissances, pariez sur les bonnes ou mauvaises réponses de vos adversaires et remportez la mise !
Et découvrez le monde du vin grâce aux réponses détaillées.

—description from the back of the box

name: Myśl Kolorem Junior
description:
How about a crazy game of colors starring? In this unusual game your task will be to give a quiz answer questions using 11 cards
colors.

In the Junior version, the questions rotate around children's interests and world - heroes of fairy tales, toys, flavors
childhood and familiar surroundings.

name: Dungeon Coin
description:
Dungeon Coin is a microgame game that fits on a coin.

Game presentation:

The player is exploring a dungeon in order to find gems.
He tries to dodge fights with monsters.
The game is short but the tension is high.


The rules are directly written on the 2 sides of the coin:

Heads - Flip the coin and see your destiny. You find a monster = you lose the game.
Tails - Flip the coin and see your destiny. You find a gem. Having 3 gems = victory.


—description from the designer

name: Clownspel
description:
The game board is divided into four circles, one for each color. In the circles there are fields in different colors that each player must walk along until they reach the last field which is the only gray field. The players move by rolling a color dice, i.e. you move to the nearest field with that color. To win, you must first have rolled black on the dice so that you get the black hat and then roll gray to reach the last field. If you roll gray before you have the black hat, you will instead have to stand over a roll.

—user summary

name: Relic Knights: Har Ancient
description:
The Har Ancient is a finely detailed resin model for the Noh Empire faction in Relic Knights. Har Ancient is an honorific bestowed upon the highest ranking members of the Nozuki priesthood within Dragon Fleet Har. Preaching madness and fury wherever he goes, the Har Ancient sows terror and madness throughout the Last Galaxy. The Har Ancient is a unique squad, allowing Noh Empire players to field one Har Ancient and his two ghostly lanterns per cadre.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: The Capitals Game
description:
The Capitals Game contains 193 Flash cards representing the recognized countries of the world (by the UN). Each card shows the flag on the back along with country details on the front.

What can you do on those long trips in the car? How can you help your kids learn more about the world?
The Capital Game allows a family to interact and learn more about the world around them.

There are unlimited ways you can play this game but the most popular are:
Who’s Flag is this?
What is the Capital of?
Guess the Country?
Biggest Wins
Countries (or capitals) by the Alphabet

The deck also comes with blank cards allowing you to hide the front (or back of the
cards) to keep other players guessing.
Each card has the flag on one side and some information about the country on the other:
Name
Capital City
Approx Population (2020)
Currency
GDP
Main Languages
Land Mass Size
Location on the globe

It also shows membership of:
G20
OECD
WTO
APEC
NATO
Commonwealth

name: Trivial Pursuit: Juventus – Bite Size
description:
Pocket version of the world famous Trivial Pursuit.
600 questions about the world of Juventus Football Club.
Some of these questions will put even the most experienced fans in difficulty!
The game does not require any board and can be carried in its convenient triangular box.
Test your knowledge of the following topics:

Coaches,
League,
Curiosities,
Players,
International Matches,
Victories.


Versione Tascabile del Famosissimo Trivial Pursuit.
600 domande sul mondo della Juventus Football Club.
Alcune di queste domande metteranno in difficoltà persino i tifosi più esperti!
Il gioco non richiede alcun tabellone e può essere trasportato nella sua comoda confezione triangolare.
Metti alla prova la tua conoscenza dei seguenti argomenti:

Allenatori,
Campionato,
Curiosità ,
Giocatori,
Partite Internazionali,
Vittorie.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Sports, Trivia

name: Best 11 Board Game: SSC Napoli
description:
Best 11 SSC Napoli football box game!
Buy players, deploy them, challenge whoever you want, manage your team.
The goal of the game is to complete the formation of 11 players, your BEST11.
Play your event cards, surprise your opponents, hire the manager, complete the stage and achieve victory.


Best 11 SSC Napoli
Compra i giocatori, schierali, sfida chi vuoi tu, gestisci il tuo team.
Obiettivo del gioco è completare la formazione di 11 giocatori, i tuoi BEST11.
Gioca le tue carte avvenimento, sorprendi i tuoi avversari, ingaggia l'allenatore, completa lo stadio e otterrai la vittoria.

name: Vendée Globe: Le Jeu de Société
description:
Vendée Globe - Set off on your monohull and circumnavigate the world in the pure Vendée Globe tradition, solo, non-stop and without assistance, but staying at home. Sail the Atlantic, the Indian and the Pacific, with friends or family, thanks to the official Vendée Globe board game.

Aficionados or beginners, to overcome this ordeal, you will need to avoid OFNIS / UFO (unidentified floating objects), ration your food and answer questions of different levels of difficulty.

Take weather options and make the right choice of sails to beat your competition.

Your sailboat race around the world by progressing on spaces. On each space, an action is requested. It may be to answer a Quiz question or undergo an event.

2 to 6 skippers can line up at the start and freshwater sailors are welcome from 7 years old.

Rest assured, you don't need to spend 78 days at sea to win, since a board tour takes between 30 and 45 minutes.


1 game box.
1 game board.
132 playing cards.
1 board with parts to detach and assemble:
3 movable parts,
2 card shoes (Quiz and Event),
Sponsor cards + Sails + food tokens.

1 ruleset
1 bag (containg a needle, 6 game pawn bases, 3 shielded ties)
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Ligue en Or
description:
Ligue en Or: The French football board game, in which you find the 20 clubs of the Uber Eats League 1, in the form of a real tournament.
The goal is to win the championship with your favorite team, among the 20 clubs in Ligue 1.

The game is divided in 2 phases.

First phase the teams are getting bought, on a map of France.
Second phase: tournament phase: teams faces each other and games are resolved using dice. The board is now in the form of stadium.


The goal is to reach the grand finale.

And bring your club to the Champions League !
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Backyardigans: Kleuren & Getallen
description:
With this card game kids learn to deal with colors and numbers in a playful manner. The game is all about collecting sets of card, either from the same color or the same number... All with the help of the Backyardigans.

—description from the back of the box (translated)

name: Engkanto
description:
Engkanto is an epic fantasy tabletop game set in pre-colonial Philippines with heroes and monsters of Filipino folklore.

Far off the coast of Samar lies a mysterious island that the tribes say is cursed. All who venture there never return. Enchanted beings called "Engkanto" disguise themselves as humans and lure innocent villagers to the island where they are taken to another plane of existence known as Biringan City.

The Gods have called upon four heroes endowed with the power of the legendary bird, Sarimanok to sail to the cursed island, find Biringan City and rescue the kidnapped villagers.

The game is for 1-4 players. Each player control a Bayani (hero) of their choice. The Bayani's goal is to venture through Enchanted Forests, explore dark caves, cross seas and head to Samar to find the legendary Biringan City. During their adventure they will find treasure to offer to ancient Filipino deities, collect items to help them survive and weapons to help them fight off the Engkanto that will try to destroy them.
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Mythology, Travel
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Progressive

name: El Juego de Santander
description:
El Juego de Santander
The game focuses on the city of Santander, its streets, local businesses and monuments are on the board.

The game play is a mixture of the game of goose and monopoly

To win: acquire businesses and leave the city.
mechanics: Events, Lose a Turn, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Festive Trivia Quiz
description: The game comes with a deck of fifty cards, each containing one Christmas-themed question, and an instruction sheet. In turn, each player is asked the question on the top card of the deck. A player keeps the card for scoring purposes when giving the correct response to the question. Cards answered incorrectly go to the bottom of the deck. The first player to score five correct answers is the winner.

name: Which Would You Pick?
description: Two decks of 40 cards contain amusing, hypothetical situations. The player on turn draws a card from each deck and secretly decides which situation he or she would rather participate in. The other players then attempt to guess which card was selected. Play proceeds clockwise to the next player. An alternative way to play involves all the players discussing which situation they would choose for themselves.

name: Doctor Doctor!
description:
Doctor Doctor! is a morbidly funny turn-based competitive strategy game about saving patients while surviving a day at the hospital. Each player assumes the role of a hospital staffer and must take care of 3 patients at a time.

Players take turns drawing from the Rounding deck on their own patients and staffers while playing cards from their hand on their opponents. The Rounding deck is comprised of cards that can help treat patients, make their conditions worse, move them around the table, prevent staff from treating their patients, and modify other cards in play.

When a patient is saved or pronounced dead, players must clear them from play and draw a new one from the Patient deck. Just like in a real hospital!

Once the last patient has been drawn, players race to be the first to clear the patients in front of them. Then they tally their Save Scores (saved minus dead) to determine the winner!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Take That

name: Trailblazer
description:
In Trailblazer each player creates a 6x6 grid and then attempts to reconstruct their opponent's grid.

A grid is created by entering a number from 1-25 in any space and then entering the next higher number in an adjacent space, and so on, until most or all of the spaces are filled; some spaces can be filled with an "X" instead of a number, but these cannot be adjacent to each other or the first or last spaces of the "trail."

After the grids are created players take turns asking each other for the contents of one space. When a player thinks they can recreate their opponent's grid they do so and win if they are correct.

name: Capture
description:
Do you want to play with Vampirella?

Two to four players will travel around the board attempting to capture monsters (or wrest them away from their captors) until they have the entire slate of monsters on one side of the four sided board captured. Play as Adam, Conrad (aka Dr. Van Helsing), Pendragon or even Vampirella herself!

This is one of several somewhat tongue-in-cheek horror games from Warren magazines (publishers of Creepy, Eerie and Vampirella, among others) created by Bill DuBay and featuring campy 70's horror board game fun.

The Capture game appeared in Vampirella Magazine #27 (September 1973) inside the cover to cut out and play, as well as separately in a bundle of "Warren Monster Madness" games by mail order (#2661 for $2.50). The bundle included Capture, Monster Match, Creepy-Crawley Castle (aka Creepy Castle), Werewolf! and Monster's Castle.

name: AH*LE: A Comedy Game
description:
A race to the finish where strategy, luck, and sabotage determine the winner. Work together or alone to rid yourself of all the cards before your rivals, and crown yourself as the biggest AH*LE there.

Each player is dealt three cards face down, which they cannot look at. Each player is additionally dealt six more cards, out of which they pick three to place face-up on top of the previously dealt face-down cards. After this setup, the game can begin!

Each player must play cards equal or higher than previous opponents. If not, they must take the pile, cursing the heavens. You can also play specialty cards, to really rustle their jimmies! In the end, players may use their earlier set-up cards, but look out! You don't always know which cards you're playing!

Enough gab, may the biggest AH*LE win!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Humor, Mature / Adult, Negotiation, Party Game

name: Vertellis Family Edition: Parents & Kids
description:
Everyday - "Life"

In our “always-on” society, the pressure on parents and children is higher than ever. Every family has their moments such as moving, new careers, and general relationship challenges. Each of these can cause a breakdown in communication and a feeling of being misunderstood.

How it works?

In a playful way, you will answer fun and serious questions that are important to a family. Every family member will feel which lowers the bar for improved communication not only during our fun games but outside of it too! Above all, this is a fun and amazing question card game to learn from each other.

What happens?

This game is for anyone who lives at home or is part of a family. As the year progresses, your answers to the questions can change. Therefore, we recommend using them more than once a year. Happy Families who are already close will find that their bonds improve even further.

The game

The game is played in four rounds. Rounds 1 and 3 have individual questions while rounds 2 and 4 are a mix of questions and assignments designed to get everyone involved and working together. Two sample questions are: If you could create a new tradition within your family, what would it be? What has been a recent happy memory with your parents?

With the Vertellis Family Edition, everyone will get their turn in the conversation.
The conversation card game will result in fun and important conversations between family members.
This is one of the family games for adults and kids from all backgrounds.
One of the greatest family games for more time together and offline
The Family Edition is one of the unique gifts that will create enriching conversations
The questions are particularly suited for fun games between parents and children
You will spend more time offline with these questions and family games for kids and adults
Family Editions are fun games bringing together the whole family

name: KFC's Travel Game
description:
The game contains card with luggage items printed on them.

Players draw cards and try to name the items depicted in the order in which they were drawn. When a player makes a mistake, they're out of the game and have lost. The last player who's still in the game, when all other players have lost, is the winner.

The game-box contains 36 card, divided as follows:

3 Cards with the rules, in Dutch, English and French.
6 Cards with items, with the background color begin yellow.
6 Cards with items, with the background color being orange.
6 Cards with items, with the background color being blue-ish.
5 Cards with items, with the background color being red.
5 Cards with items, with the background color being purple.
5 Cards with items, with the background color being green.


Although there are 6 different colors, the rules do not indicate that they are to be used differently or have different value compared to others colors.

This game was published as part of a promotional campaign for the KFC restaurant group.

—user summary

name: KFC's Color Addict
description:
The game contains cards with the names of colors printed on them. Each named color is printed in 5 colors (all that are also named) and two jokers. The cards are dealt evenly to all players, with each player holding 3 cards in hard, the rest as a drawing stack.
