The purpose of the game is to get rid of your own cards first, including your own draw pile. To do this, when it's your turn, you try to match one of your hand cards with the color or word of the last played card. If you can't match, you draw a card from your own draw pile.

The dealer plays the top card from their draw pile as the first card to match.

The game-box contains 36 card, divided as follows:

1 card with the rules.
7 cards, in 5 colors + 2 jokers, with the word 'Blue'.
7 cards, in 5 colors + 2 jokers, with the word 'Green'.
7 cards, in 5 colors + 2 jokers, with the word 'Yellow'.
7 cards, in 5 colors + 2 jokers, with the word 'Orange'.
7 cards, in 5 colors + 2 jokers, with the word 'Red'.


Each word is printed in the colors blue, green, yellow, orange and red once and two cards have a mix of the colors, indicating them as joker cards.

This game resembles Crazy Eights / UNO, but without the "take that" cards.

This game was published as part of a promotional campaign for the KFC restaurant group.

—user summary

name: Relic Quest
description:
When war broke out between the Five Kingdoms it devastated Sanctum as all sides scorched the land to defeat one another. The Great War came to an abrupt end as the magic that had been so plenteous in the past had mysteriously vanished. The only magic left to the people was that which was bound to certain relics. These powerful items are scattered throughout the world of Santum and Guilds pay handsome sums of gold to those willing to pluck them from obscurities grasp. Some seek them for power, while others attempt to keep them from falling into the wrong hands.

Relic Quest is a fantasy quest and dungeon crawler with simple mechanics for the entire family to enjoy:

Single and Multiplayer as well as other modes of play.
Character Development based on a simple level system.
Immersive world and game play.


—description from publisher

name: Tranquility: The Ascent – Friends in High Places Promo
description: Included for all Kickstarter backers of Tranquility: The Ascent, and with limited availability post-campaign, the Friends in high places adds five unique player powers to the game. Shuffle the powers as part of the setup and deal one randomly to each player. They now have access to one powerful ability that may make the difference between winning and losing.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Number
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Tile Placement

name: Fishin'
description:
Fish from your pond, another player's pond and the Secret Fishin' Hole.

Catch the most Fishin' points in 3 rounds.

The game includes 15 different types of fish cards with values of either 1, 5, 10, 15, 20 or 25. There are also 6 MINE!, 6 SNAG! and 1 Old Boot card.

Players have a "fishing pond" in front of them (5 face down cards) plus the draw pile. They start with a hand of 5 cards and on their turn they do one of the following:

Choose the top card from the discard pile
Choose the top card from the Draw Pile
Choose any face up card in another players pond if it makes an immediate match


Players then place any match in their hand into their Catch Basket. They end their turn by flipping one card from their Pond face up.

MINE! and SNAG! cards can be played one per round and allow the player to hinder other players.

The game lasts 3 rounds and the player with the highest score in their Catch Basket wins the game.

name: Erê: O Jogo dos Orixás
description:
Erê: The Game of the Orixás is a card game about elements of the Yoruba religion found in Brazil today. Cards show different Orixás (deities), some with special effects, others with points for scoring.
In each round, players draft five cards. Then they take turns playing one card each in front of them, using the effects when there is one, otherwise collecting sets. There are some open and some hidden objective cards, and the players will try to fulfill as many of these as possible.
The player with most points after three rounds wins the game.

name: Millennial AF
description:
What is a mile… What is a mimosa… What is a millennial? It’s a pretty common question on Google. The millennial generation has generated more intrigue than any other. And rightly so in our opinion. That’s why we created Millennial AF: the “Who’s most likely to” card game that’ll reveal the biggest bottomless brunching, quinoa munching, Insta-influencing millennial in your group.

Here’s how it might play out…
Jess: “Who’s most likely to… text ‘I’m outside’ rather than ring the doorbell?
Josh: “Well that can’t be me. I’d never do that.”
Sam: “That’s totes something you’d do, Josh!”
Jess: “Josh IMHO.”
George: “Josh. Without a doubt.”
Josh: “WTF?!”

Josh then gets that card. And at the end each player tallies their cards; the one with the most is the most millennial of them all.

Millennial AF is the generational game based on typical millennial traits. You’ll be surprised at just how millennial we all are…

name: Warehouse 13: The H.G. Wells Expansion
description:
In Warehouse 13: The H.G. Wells Expansion, players take on the role of Warehouse Agents who must work together to retrieve artifacts. But should H.G. be trusted? Or is she helping you only because she wants to collect the two pieces of the Minoan Trident?

Warehouse 13: The H.G. Wells Expansion works much like the base game, where one Traitor is working against a team of Warehouse Agents. For every artifact that is lost, H.G. will be able to search for pieces of the Trident. If both Trident pieces are found, the Finale immediately begins. Unlike the base game, if three artifacts are lost, there is no Finale; the game ends and the Agents lose.

What if MacPherson had stayed loyal as Artie’s partner? Now you can find out. Not only are H.G. Wells and James MacPherson Adversaries, they are also playable Agents. Also included are Jack Secord and Rebecca St. Clair, two Warehouse Agents from the 1950’s and 1960’s.

The new Warehouse Status module increases the challenge by making things difficult for the Warehouse Agents each episode. But Mrs. Frederic is here to help with her new module, providing assistance wherever she is needed. These modules can be used individually or together and with either MacPherson or H.G. Wells as the Adversary.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Semi-Cooperative Game, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Flick the Ship
description:
Flick the Ship is a turn-based pencil-and-paper naval warfare game where 2-4 players use their skill in flicking a pencil across paper to fight each other, sea monsters, and sometimes even the seascape itself.

Players collect experience points to level up their vessel, and can forge alliances with other ships to make massive fleets. By collecting gold doubloons, additional "mini-ships" can be bought for more casual, low-stakes play.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology, Nautical, Pirates, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Alliances, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Contracts, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Flicking, Line Drawing, Line of Sight, Lose a Turn, Paper-and-Pencil, Trading, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Charms: Quests For Antiracism
description:
Quests for Antiracism can expand CHARMS: A Game of Insight. Players ask questions, roll and interpret inspiring game pieces, and try to discover the most amazing insights toward antiracism. *Or the game's questions can be used for dialogue, reflection, or writing prompts on your own or with any size group. Includes options for online play!

—description from the publisher

name: A Year as a Pirate
description:
Set sail with your crew and plunder the ships carrying riches from the New World. The Golden Age of Piracy awaits you with Riches and Glory or The Noose.

There is:

The Caribbean to explore.
Ports to trade in, new Ships to buy and Crew to hire.
Many merchants to chase down and rob.
Ships of the Line to fight (or run from).
Famous pirates to meet or best.
Privateers to avoid or become one yourself.
Dangerous seas to Navigate.


Play on your own or together with friends in this co-operative pirate game where you are the Captain and crew of a ship. The games runs at a week at a time, so you can play for a year or have a full Saga and play till you are as rich as kings. The game is easy to save your progress and come back to at another time. Play against the game and with your friends. Victory is achieved by accumulating enough treasure to retire, but there is whole list of harder goals for more daring pirates. Navigate your ship across the sea, searching for prise cargo ships hoping that luck (dice) will bring fortune your way. But if chance brings a Spanish, French or English ship of the Line your way you may need to run for it. They are likely to out Gun you, out Man you and if you loose the fight and survive you will be hanged.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Age of Reason, Pirates, Print & Play
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Mint Mini
description:
Mint Mini is bringing players back into Mintopia with mini-games designed around the mechanics of previous Mint entries. A dice drafting game that is built to give you a taste of each Mint Mechanic. Draft Works, and you play a mini worker placement, Draft Delivery and you will deliver Mints, and so on.

Welcome Back to Mintopia!

—description from the designer

This Game never actually delivered to backers because the company went bancrupt. So besides a few pre-production copies for reviewers, it is non-existent at this point.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Worker Placement

name: CubeClimbers
description:
CubeClimbers is a strategy game for 2-4 players where the objective is to become king of the hill by stacking cubes, pushing opponents, tossing grappling hooks, and using superpowers. The cubes in this game magnetically snap together for a modular and sturdy 3D board. Climbing to the top requires creativity, tactics, precision, diplomacy, and risk-taking.

Setup: Players start on a base of prearranged cubes. Each player is then dealt an even and equal number of the remaining cubes. Players are also dealt a combination of 2 unique player powers face down that can each be used once a game.

Play: During their turn, players build 2 cubes, move to an adjacent space, and roll. Rolling gives players a chance to reposition with the grappling hook (1/2 chance) or push all players in a direction of their choice with wind (1/6 chance). Players must perform all three actions once in any order to end their turn and may also use their powers as optional actions. The game keeps going until the player who builds the last remaining cube ends their turn.

Winning: The player at the highest level of the mountain when the game ends wins!
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, King of the Hill, Modular Board, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Stacking and Balancing, Team-Based Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Don't Get Got!:  Working From Home Edition
description:
Work can be tough — even when you’re sitting on the sofa. Luckily, we’ve got just the thing to help brighten up your virtual office. A mini game designed to be played with your workmates, while you work from home.
You and your co-workers each start with six secret missions. The first player to complete three of their missions, wins.
Every single one of these missions involves tricking another player, and they’re all based around video conference calls. So, whether you’re in a 10 person Zoom meeting or a one-on-one Skype session, you better bring your A-game. There’s no telling what might be on the agenda.

name: City Break
description:
In British English, a city break is a short holiday spent in a city. City breaks are perfect for anyone looking to relax and get away from it all for a few days, as well as seeking out authentic experiences. City Break is about your memories that you are proud of and like to tell people about, and the roles you adopt when you talk about your past travels!
You come back from your city breaks very enthusiastic and ready to share them with others. Your memories turn into posts on social media or face-to-face narrations about what you have observed, encountered, or undergone. You have to announce your adventures to the world! And you don't usually tell trivial stories!
Who are you when you boast about where you went and what you did or saw? When you talk passionately about the arts, you turn into a Culture Creature. You are also the Royalty Buff who devours biographies of kings and queens and enjoys visiting their castles and palaces. There is an inner Happy Foodie inside you who loves mentioning unique and memorable food and drink experiences. Your social media profiles reveal a Nature Lover who marvels at the mysteries of nature and appreciates natural beauty. Only a Sights Seeker would plan ahead for trips to the world's busiest sights and landmarks. Your followers can't wait to watch live the Motion Addict who loves public transport, the best way to connect to the city.

City Break is a one-of-a-kind puzzle-solving board game specifically designed for a pair of gamers. What makes City Break truly awesome is that it manages to achieve an incredible strategic depth in a two-player setting. City Break is about adapting to new information, making the right choices at the right time, and solving the puzzle of the combinations of available digit-tiles, cards, and action tokens. The game gets more and more intense with each played card, while you have to keep an eye on your opponent's playing space so as not to be surprised by suddenly ending the game!

Players use cards to fill six columns with memories, creating narratives about their past travels. They need to make sure that their narratives are credible, so they must bring them into a state of equilibrium or harmony. The credibility of a narrative is determined by its 3 sub-columns of values. Equilibrium is when a part of your narrative is in balance with the other two parts taken together (for example, B = A + C). Harmony is when two parts of your narrative balance each other out (for example, B = C).

You pursue a diversity of interests when you travel, and you develop new personas when you talk about where you went and what you did or saw. Each of the 6 outlined columns of cards of your tableau corresponds to a + or = represented at the bottom of the 90 personas. Each persona has a combination of 2 + and/or = indicating the 2 narratives you need to be credible. + symbols indicate which narratives you need to bring into equilibrium. = symbols indicate which narratives you need to bring into harmony.

At the end of your turn, if all 6 of your outlined columns of cards either have complete narratives placed on them or are disabled, your opponent gets one final turn. The game then ends and players calculate their final scores.

Your goal is to score the most Victory Points by assembling long credible narratives, developing personas, achieving target values, matching images, and earning titles. Are you quick-witted enough to deal with changing conditions, elements of randomness, and unpredictable opponents? Find out in City Break!
mechanics: Layering, Matching, Memory, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Auksinis protas: Startas Nr. 1
description:
The game consists of 100 cards with 200 questions, an answer book and 10 joker cards, of which the TV game hosts - Arūnas Valinskas and Andrius Tapinas - will give the players fun QR tasks. You can compete one on one or form teams and embark on a real intelligence fight.
The game begins with the first round of cards (1 to 50 cards and with 5 joker cards) to be shuffled and folded on the table. Cards are drawn in turn, questions are read aloud. If the game is a team based, team members can consult with each other. Answers are checked by the opponent or the opposing team. After playing the first round, the second is played on the same principle (from 51 to 100 cards and with 5 joker cards).
1 point is awarded for the correct answer. For proper performance of the joker's task - 3 points. For transferring a joker card to another player (or team) without reading the QR code - 0 points. After scanning the QR code of a missed task, 1 point is deducted. The participant or team with the most points wins.

The cards can be used as a stand-alone game or as an expansion for "Golden Mind: a great board game". Also, this game can be expanded with "Golden Mind. Start No. 2" cards.


Žaidimą sudaro 100 kortelių su 200 klausimų, atsakymų knygelė ir 10 džokerio kortelių, nuo kurių nuskaičius QR smagias užduotis žaidėjams pateiks patys TV žaidėjų vedėjai - Arūnas Valinskas ir Andrius Tapinas. Galite rungtis vienas prieš vieną arba sudaryti komandas ir leistis į tikriausią intelekto kovą.
Žaidimas pradedamas pirmojo turo kortelėmis (nuo 1 iki 50 kortelės ir su 5 džokerio kortelėmis), kurias reikia sumaišyti ir užverstas padėti ant stalo. Kortelės traukiamos paeiliui, klausimai skaitomi garsiai. Jei žaidimas komandinis, komandos nariai gali tartis tarpusavyje. Atsakymus tikrina priešininkas arba priešininkų komanda. Sužaidus pirmąjį turą, tokiu pat principu žaidžiamas antrasis (nuo 51 iki 100 kortelės ir su 5 džokerio kortelėmis).
Už teisingą atsakymą skiriamas 1 taškas. Už tinkamą džokerio užduoties atlikimą – 3 taškai. Už džokerio kortelės perleidimą kitam žaidėjui (ar komandai) nenuskaičius QR kodo – 0 taškų. Už neatliktą užduotį nuskaičius QR kodą atimamas 1 taškas. Laimi daugiausia taškų surinkęs dalyvis arba komanda.

Kortelės gali būti naudojamos kaip atskiras žaidimas arba papildyti žaidimą „Auksinis protas: Didysis stalo žaidimas". Taip pat, šį žaidimą galima praplėsti su "Auksinis protas. Startas Nr. 2" kortomis.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Stormsunder: Stretch Goal Box
description:
The Stretch Goal Box will hold all Stretch Goals reached during the crowdfunding of Stormsunder.

The following SGs were unlocked during the campaign:
Davor, Aide to the Council
Feilheim, the Hinterlord
Liora, the Gatekeeper
Lord Gregor
Lorelei Blackburn, Captain of the Starfire
Map of Tarpit
Quell, Hero of Tarpitt
Rask, the Half-Giant Hermit
Steelweb Spider
The design-a-hero Hero
The Old Kingdom Map
Vacrem, the Chosen
2x Chameleon, Friend of the Desert
3x Council Enchantresses
2x Desert Dog, Companion of Life
2x Earth Spirit, Tiny Stone Giants
2x Fire Spirit, Enemies of the Storm
2x Gryphon, Defenders of Irynnath
2x Hawk, Companion of Nyere
2x Ice Golem, Enemy of the Desert
3x Retann Fireslingers
2x Runecannons
2x Runetech Golems
2x The Wrathful
Drustan (The Rangers Crossover)
Horned Golem (Wild Assent Crossover)
The Scavanger (Posthuman Saga Crossover)
The Ursus (Oathsworn Crossover)
26x Ability Card
6x Consumable Card
10x Epic Equipment
5x Rare Equipment
13x Signature Skill
3x Origin Quest
4x Additional Side Quest
1x Crafting Adventure
1x Crafting Quest
2x Creature Hunt
1x Exploration Side Quest
2x Epic Exploration Side Quest
2x Epic Side Quest

name: Monopoly: JoJo Siwa
description:
Put on your high tops and your biggest bow to get ready for the brightest, most exciting Monopoly game ever! Join the party with a worldwide superstar as sweets, sparkles, and of course hair bows beam from the tabletop with Monopoly: JoJo Siwa.

Believe in yourself with a version of the classic game that's as playful and positive as the role model herself! The fun doesn't stop as you buy, sell, and trade locations named for all of JoJo's favorite hair bows, such as the colorful Unicorn Horn, super fancy Pink and Gold Pearl, or the starred and striped All-American Girl!

Move just like the Dance Moms performer with every turn using six custom tokens for all the tour essentials: choose the Cupcake to feel like a kid in a candy store, follow your D.R.E.A.M. with the Unicorn or Rainbow, strut the board with the High-Top Shoe, take BowBow for a walk, or grab the Microphone to shout it out wherever you are!
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: F**k. The Game
description:
This is a great social card game that will f**k with your head by using a hysterically tricky combination of colours and swear words.

Players take turns to flip over a card and shout out what they see.
Depending on your card, you might say its background colour, its text colour or a swear word. Keep playing until someone f**ks up and is forced to pick up all the cards. The winner is the first player to get rid of their cards.

It sounds simple, but the cards use a psychological phenomenon – the Stroop effect – known to mess with your head and delay your brain’s response. Players can’t help but f**k up, sending the group into fits of laughter.

Once you’ve mastered the basics, you can take the game to a whole new level with more rules, more strategy and you can even create your own rules.

name: King of 12: Turnierspiel Promo
description:
King of 12 - Tournament Promo
King of 12 - Turnierspiel Promo
It is possible to play with up to 16 players.
Multiple games are needed.
You play in different groups like you do in a normal game. Each winner within his or her group will the compete with the winner of the other group.

name: Memo Match
description:
In this game you have to collect 3 bird cards.
16 bird cards, 16 square memory cards (attributes)
Each bird has one of two possibilities of the 4 attributes: eyes, feathers on the head, beak, claws.
The activ player turns a bird card from the bird card deck.
Now he turns 1 memory card after each other, as long as he finds a matching attribute to the bird card.
If he finds all 4, he wins the bird card. If he turns a wrong attribute or a right the second time, his turn is over.
In bioth cases all memory cards are turned on the backside.
Who wins the third bird card wins the game.

—user summary

name: The Legend of Zelda Game Comic Part 1
description:
A very rare, limited release board game bundled and sold with candy by Bandai.

The players spin the wheel to figure out how much to move (1-3 spaces). Then, they move their token and defeat monsters (also by spinning the wheel) to collect weapon tokens.

Once someone has four weapon tokens, the game turns into the dungeon phase, wherein players race to get to the boss and defeat it, acquiring a triforce fragment. Then the game goes back to the overworld and the process is repeated.

Whoever has the most triforce pieces by the end of the fourth dungeon wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Legend of Zelda Game Comic Part 2
description:
A very rare, limited release board game bundled and sold with candy by Bandai.

The players spin the wheel to figure out how much to move (1-3 spaces). Then, they move their token and defeat monsters (also by spinning the wheel) to collect weapon tokens.

Once someone has four weapon tokens, the game turns into the dungeon phase, wherein players race to get to the boss and defeat it, acquiring a triforce fragment. Then the game goes back to the overworld and the process is repeated.

Whoever has the most triforce pieces by the end of the ninth dungeon wins.

name: Rise of the Necromancers: Undead Sea
description:
Undead Sea is the totally new expansion for Rise of the Necromancers, and it comes with a new game board with new lands to explore, new items to find, new Necromancers to play, and new apprentices to bind to your will! And let's not forget all the new Monsters to defeat and raise!

Our Isle being flooded as a result of summoning the Demons, we are reduced once more, lowly and wretched, and must set sail to the West to seek vengeance on the Forces of Light.
Finding the wrecked bones of broken ships and merging them with our Soul Fragment, we sail into uncharted and treacherous waters. We must venture forth to explore unknown lands in search of powerful treasures. Encountering ancient threats, we defeat them and they soon become our most powerful minions.

New victory conditions add further challenges! Now, not only do you have to be first to place your 13 Dominion counters, you must hold a city of the Light, too! Being evil just got harder!

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Fog of Love: Valentine's Day 2020 promo
description:
Promotional card for Valentine's Day 2020.

You suggest a quiet night at home.

Promo 17

name: Crazy Bull
description:
HAVE YOU GOT WHAT IT TAKES? This game requires good skills and a strategy in order to win.. simply load the bull up with you accessories, wind it up and watch as he goes crazy trying to get the stuff off his back! Tipping up, down and around the bull will make sure he's victorious.. unless you think you can beat him!

The player that collects the most items is the winner of the game.

name: Unsolved Case 0001: Marta Alfieri
description:
Marta Alfieri, 26, was found dead in her apartment on her birthday 3-06-2019. Her roommate and best friend, Leonardo Salo, found her at 9:10 pm. The two lived together with two other roommates in the usually quiet town of Vernò, or at least apparently. Behind the calm lurks the storm, and it will be you who will have to solve the case. The Vernò police station will rely on you and deliver all the materials to you.

Unsolved Case:0001 is an at home mystery game, were you receive a police file with documents, photos, diagrams, etc and have to deduce the killer.

Inside the game you will find the sealed envelope with the solution. However, if you don't want to give up and open the envelope, you will have some help. In the box, you will be provided with a code that you will need to send us in case you want to ask for our help.

Il primo gioco di simulazione investigativa italiano.
Un gioco che non è usuale.
Non sarà il solito gioco in scatola, anche perché qui la scatola non sarà presente!
Immaginate di essere degli investigatori.
Perfetto. Noi vi consegneremo la “busta delle indagini”.
All’intento troverete tutto il materiale che vi servirà per risolvere l’omicidio.
Voi dovrete metterci solamente un po’...di Intuito!

name: Jurassic Parts: Paleo-Journalist Promo Card
description:
Originally available as part of Pack A from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Text says:
Play this card during a split to reduce a player's total by one chisel before determining rank order (player cannot be reduced to zero). Give this card to that player who may re-use it in any future split.

name: Alice in Wordland: Curiouser & Curiouser
description:
New guests arrive at the tea party bringing even more joy and chaos.
Players need to follow even madder rules and things are getting curiouser and curiouser!

Curiouser & Curiouser expansion introduces 4 new characters (the King of Hearts, the March Hare, the Duchess and the Jabberwock) and a new Event mechanic with quirky happenings every round affecting scoring and the character abilities. A mini game might even be added!

Every round, players change their character and a new Event is drawn, changing either the rules or the scoring of the round. Then, according to the rules of the base game, three Forbidden Letters and a Discussion theme are drawn. The player to the left of the Queen of Hearts presses the teapot to start the timer and the game begins.
Each player has to say a word, suitable to the Discussion theme while avoiding the Forbidden Letters before the time runs out. If they successfully do so, they reset the timer and the next player has to give their own word. If someone doesn't say a suitable word in time they are out for the round and when only one player remains the round ends. The longer each player stays in a round, the more points they are awarded.

—description from the designer

name: Biergarten (Second edition)
description:
In Biergarten, players compete to create the most beautiful Biergartens before Oktoberfest. Each turn, players will draw one tile from the supply, the open market, or randomly from another player's hand, then play one tile to expand their Biergarten and score points. Players score points by playing tiles that have matching colors, linking up umbrellas, and walling off their Biergarten. The player with the most points by the time Oktoberfest rolls around wins!

The game includes 76 beautifully illustrated tiles for players to choose from to truly make their Biergartens unique.

This second edition of Biergarten introduces all-new art, upgraded components, and new ways to play, including a solo mode.

Prost!
mechanics: Enclosure, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: The Fully Automated Board Game
description:
The Fully Automated Board Game is a fast party game based on robots, unionism, and achieving full automation. The game is for 2 to 10 players and features elements of diplomacy, bluffing, and a pinch of Luddism.

In The Fully Automated Board Game you will be able to play the role of a proud worker or a corrupt boss. The goal of the workers, who play semi-cooperatively, is to expropriate as many robots as possible. The objective of the two bosses, competing both with the workers and with each other, is to accumulate lots of money!

Each turn of the game is developed in seven phases and represents one month of work. During the month, bosses can hire workers or build obedient robots. On the other hand, workers are not obliged to accept jobs and can even go on strike, bearing in mind that at the end of the month they may no longer have the money to pay the rent.

—description from the designer
categories: Economic, Party Game, Political, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action/Event, Alliances, Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Simulation

name: Think: Logo Cards
description:
70 cards with puzzles in three difficulty stages that are to be solved using logic, fantasy and an eye for details. Points can be scored upon solving the puzzle depending on difficulty, and some extra points when answering a surprise extra question regarding details in the picture. Solution and explanation are provided on the back of the picture cards. Every card is a single puzzle only.

Description from the publisher:
"Lösen Sie knifflige Bilderrätsel. Allein mit Logik und Fantasie." ("Solve challenging picture puzzles with logic and fantasy alone.")

name: Whose Nest?
description:
Crafty Croc has stolen all the eggs! Luckily, we have his swag bag. Can you return all the eggs to their correct nests?

Roll the dice! If you roll an egg, take the egg and place it in a nest. Will it hatch as a Chick or a Croc? If a chick, take a token...if a Croc, oh no! put the egg back in the bag.

Each player after their go, spins the nest! Can you remember where the croc hatched?

The first player to return all 3 baby chicks to the nest wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Anastyr: The All-Mother's Secret
description: The Primordial Jungles are home to the densest forests of Alboraan. Legend has it that this mysterious, impenetrable land was seeded from the tears of the All-Mother weeping over her people, slaughtered by dragons in ancient times. The forests are so dense that light rarely reaches the ground. An inextricable network of lianas and branches makes any progression hostile and laborious. In the shadows lurk the terrible saber-toothed tigers and immense carnivorous plants.Few are those who dare to penetrate this compact green danger zone and make contact with the fierce tribes living near the ancient temples of their ancestors. But they are also the guardians of the black lotus, a flower with extraordinary properties... The Companions of the Spear know that this flower would be an unparalleled asset in the fight against the forces of Anastyr, but this quest comes at a cost. The powerful Tanit, known as the goddess of the jungle, reigns supreme over this trade and convincing her will not be easy. In addition, the goddess who claims to be the reincarnation of the All-Mother herself is waging her own war against the tribes who refuse to join her cult, and in particular against Karanja, her main rival.

name: Anastyr: The Necromancer's Plague
description:
The Bone Swamp lies between the Jade Sea and the Dark Swamp. This territory is named after the megadons who have lived in this area for centuries. The skeletons of their ancestors can be seen above the stagnant waters and in some places they look like open graveyards. The region is inhabited by the "Primitives," a fierce people who worship the All-Mother and consider themselves her children. The Primitives, also known as the Firstborn, consider the swamp to be sacred ground. They are also the guardians of the megadons, whose survival they have ensured over the centuries, despite the presence of dragons that frequently preyed on their eggs.

The region is inhabited by the "Primitives," a fierce people who worship the All-Mother and consider themselves her children. The Primitives, also known as the Firstborn, consider the swamp to be sacred ground. They are also the guardians of the megadons, whose survival they have ensured over the centuries, despite the presence of dragons that frequently preyed on their eggs. Each tribe was born in the wake of one of these ancestral creatures, whose name it has taken. Over the centuries, the tribe watches over the offspring of "their" megadon and ensures that it matures safe from predators. The primitive tribes live in lakeside villages. The matriarch's home is always found at the center of these villages, where wood is mixed with the remains of the ancestral megadon's egg. The Firstborn communication uses very specific tongue clicks, which allows them to hunt over large areas and to implement their battle plans against their enemies.

When moving through the swamps, the Primitives use stilts, the length of which determines their social position within the tribe. To travel longer distances, they ride Kurdai, mounts imported from the High Plains centuries ago. Today, kurdai are found in most village enclosures but also in the wild, as they have become an endemic animal of the swamps.

Unfortunately, an unprecedented threat has been looming over the Bone Swamp for nearly twenty years: the Plague. This disease corrupts living creatures, both animals and humans. In its final stage, the infected become rabid and kill each other. The Firstborn fear that the megadon eggs will also fall victim to this terrifying disease, especially since some of them are regularly traded during the passage of the Great Caravan, in exchange for iron and precious stones... These extremely precious eggs are indeed sought after by all the caravan masters, to enlarge their convoy and ensure their prosperity.

name: Anastyr: Echoes of Abscalon
description:
The Frozen Mountains - Discover the genesis of Anastyr and Abscalon on an adventure that will lead them to change the fate of Alboraan.

A new region: Majestic snow-capped mountains, deadly cold, and brutal clans with rites of madness.

Face the Ice Witch and her regal white dragon in an epic duel... but an even greater challenge awaits you!

Deal with nature's hostility and chilling weather while keeping you opponents from being overcome by a murderous rage.

name: Anastyr: The Queen's Vow
description:
The Necropolis of the Mad Kings - The Companions of the Spear face a new threat that could forever change the face of Alboraan.

A new region: a mysterious necropolis, the tomb of an ancient civilization and the kingdom of the necromancer Abscalon.

Legions of the living dead, wraiths of demented kings, and a fearsome amber hearted bone golem block our Heroes' way.

Halt the dead from rising once more by eliminating the source of their immortality.

name: Speak Out: Not Famous Movie Quotes
description:
Get friends together for some sidesplitting fun as players try to say different phrases while wearing a mouthpiece that won't let them shut their mouth. This expansion pack features phrases that sound a lot like famous movie quotes…but just "off" enough to challenge players and generate lots of laughs. Players draw from the deck and read the phrase as best as they can, but it's not so easy to do when the mouthpiece is hindering them from forming words correctly. Players try to say phrases such as "We need to walk about your weepy mess reports". Teammates must correctly guess the phrase in under a minute in order to earn the card. The team with the most cards at the end of the game wins. The expansion pack can be added to the original Speak Out game or 1 player can use the mouthpiece and everyone else can guess what he or she is saying. (Timer not included in expansion pack.)

Contents: 144 Pieces of Content on 72 Double Sided Content Cards, 1 Washable Mouth Piece, Instructions.

name: Anastyr: Unexpected Allies Expansion
description:
Kickstarter Exclusive: Adds four new heroes to the game

Tharn, the Lost One
Kshayesh, the Venom Master
Malka, the Wild Sovereign
Kosan, the Fearless Alchemist

name: Rivenstone
description:
The Broken Anvil Miniatures Team is proud to present Rivenstone, a brand new tabletop miniature skirmish wargame featuring highly detailed miniatures and thrilling tempo-based gameplay! Rivenstone is an alternating activation, skirmish-style tabletop wargame designed to appeal to players of all experience levels. The rules are easy to understand and play, with loads of strategic depth to explore and experience on the tabletop. Reinforcement mechanics prevent a player from losing to attrition, creating a game focused on tempo based decisions and tactical planning instead.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling

name: Putin's Pocket: Ukrainian Cauldron at Debaltseve – Feb 2015
description:
Putin's Pocket is a game on the face-off between Ukrainian and Russian forces at the Debaltseve pocket, which protruded like a finger into the Russian\DPR front lines in January, 2015.

The pro-Russian forces were unable to collapse the Ukrainian pocket or cut it off in January even as Putin allowed Russian battalion tactical groups to gradually take over. The whole area became a target for the many Russian artillery within range and was heavily bombarded.

name: Escape Experience Adventskalender: Die einsame Berghütte
description:
Solve a new puzzle every day and unravel the mystery of the hidden gift factory. Find out what the lonely mountain hut and the creepy creature are all about and help your new friends...

Combine the 24 exciting puzzles with mystical objects such as a Rubik's Cube, glow-in-the-dark clues and other bizarre objects. Only the correct solution will lead you to the next door and the next puzzle. And if you get stuck, the digital extras will help you with hints and solutions to all the puzzles, as well as three hidden extra missions.

If you manage to solve every puzzle, hopefully all the presents will be ready in time for the holidays! Let the extra tricky Advent escape room experience begin!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Princess Wands
description:
Cooperative Story Game about the Adventures of Alina, Mckenzlie, Hanna and Starry as they take on Dragonthorn and make games with their wands. Learn how they influence the dragon to give up his gold and give him a new name. Move your character portraits around the board as you read the story. The character portraits go to the locations on the game board to match the scenes in the book. Once you have mastered the lore and learned how the wands work, use the playing cards to play out the CARD GAME! Matching the characters on the cards you force other players to draw cards based on how many characters you match! If you put the wands together you win the game!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Matching, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Adventures in Neverland: The Quest for the Hideout
description:
A booster (story deck) to change up your game!

This booster features James Hook in "The Quest for the Hideout."

Besides a brand new story, every booster will include new items, special locations, encounters, and tasks!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Novel-based

name: Adventures in Neverland: The Grinning Reaper
description:
A booster (story deck) to change up your game!

This is the Kickstarter exclusive cooperative story "The Grinning Reaper."

Besides a brand new story, every booster will include new items, special locations, encounters, and tasks!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Novel-based

name: 海洋公園 (Ocean-Taiwan)
description:
Collect a variety of saltwater fish to create an attractive aquarium.

Players develop their aquariums by purchasing saltwater fish and the equipment to keep them each round.

Saltwater fish increase the attractiveness of the aquarium, and this attractiveness leads to revenue.

Breeding saltwater fish requires corresponding equipment. Lack of equipment damages saltwater fish and ultimately kills them.

In addition, saltwater fish produce garbage, so there is a need to increase garbage disposal capacity to accommodate them.

多様な海水魚を集めて魅力的な水族館を作りましょう。

プレイヤーは毎ラウンド海水魚およびそれを飼育するための設備を購入し、水族館を発展させます。

海水魚は水族館の魅力を上げ、この魅力は収益につながります。

海水魚を飼育するには対応する設備が必要です。設備が不足すると海水魚はダメージを受け、最終的に死亡します。

また、海水魚はゴミを出すので、それに対応してゴミ処理能力を上げる必要もあります。
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Educational, Environmental
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Pop Chumps: Drag Edition
description:
Pop Chumps: Drag Edition is a card game that allows you and your fishy friends to battle it out with some of your favourite queens from RuPaul's Drag Race.

Each Ru-Girl has been illustrated in their most iconic moments with categories such as Runway Rating and Lip-sync Level, the game puts you straight into the workroom to see if you can become America's Next Drag Superstar.

Volume one features fan favourites including Shangela, Adore Delano, Bianca Del Rio, Laganja Estranja, Sharon Needles, Valentina, Bob The Drag Queen, Jujubee, Tatianna, Latrice Royale, and the iconic Stacy Layne Matthews.

Drag Edition can be played as a standalone game, or combined with Drag Edition 2 for even more queens!
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Adventures in Neverland: A Tale of Mischief
description:
A booster (story deck) to change up your game!

This booster features Tinker Bell in "A Tale of Mischief."

Besides a brand new story, every booster will include new items, special locations, encounters, and tasks!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Novel-based

name: Adventures in Neverland: The Lost Ring
description:
A booster (story deck) to change up your game!

This booster features Mr. Smee in "The Lost Ring."

Besides a brand new story, every booster will include new items, special locations, encounters, and tasks!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Novel-based

name: Adventures in Neverland: The Lost Faerie
description:
A booster (story deck) to change up your game!

This booster features Peter Pan in "The Lost Faerie."

Besides a brand new story, every booster will include new items, special locations, encounters, and tasks!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Novel-based

name: Adventures in Neverland: A New Wind
description:
A booster (story deck) to change up your game!

This booster features Wendy Darling in "A New Wind."

Besides a brand new story, every booster will include new items, special locations, encounters, and tasks!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Novel-based

description:
A booster (story deck) to change up your game!

This booster features Tiger Lily in "The Lily and the Rose."

Besides a brand new story, every booster will include new items, special locations, encounters, and tasks!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Novel-based

name: Trust Me I'm a Doctor: Surgeons at Sea
description:
Set sail and learn even more medical things you wish you never knew in this swashbuckling expansion pack! Adds 33 new cures and 20 new ailments to your Trust Me I'm a Doctor card game!

Based on research into real medical cures and ailments aboard galleons and man o' was in the age of sail, you'll be treating scurvy and maggot-eye with hot tar and bone saws in no time!

—description from the back of the box
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Humor, Medical, Negotiation, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Acting, Hand Management, Negotiation, Real-Time, Role Playing, Storytelling, Voting

name: The Fun Game of Switch (Second Edition)
description:
In The Fun Game of Switch players are trying to be the first to assemble a full train by rolling to move along tracks and switch between the inner and outer track lines. It is a simple spin-and-move game with 'Switches' that can alter your direction of movement. When reaching a switch, the player stops and rolls again to see which track line to use to move further. It is a simple even-odd 50-50 determination.

The goal is to build a train, starting with an engine, then two rail cars and end with a caboose. The first player to do this wins. Building is accomplished by drawing the correct card (cardboard pieces) at random when the player lands on a "Draw Card" space. The "cards" are upside down. A locomotive engine must be drawn first, then the rail cars. The caboose is last, just like in the old kids’ story The Little Red Caboose. If the ‘card’ drawn is not the correct one, it is returned to the draw pile.

This second edition is very different than the original edition of The Fun Game of Switch in design and components. The original edition was a “spin and move” race game with a small network of tracks and switches. Just about everything is different other than the name, box cover and the use of a (thin) train switching theme.

While it appears the original edition game publication is from the 50’s (based on web info and artwork) this second edition appears to date from the latter 70’s and into the 80’s. The original publisher initially produced this game under the Warren Built Rite Games brand but stopped after a few years. Starting around 1981 the Tee Pee Toys, Jessup Paper Box Co. produced this game and a few others under license with a few small changes to the box and inclusion of punch out player tokens on the game board rather than pawns.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement
publishers: Tee Pee Toys, Jessup Paper Box Co., Warren Built Rite Games

name: Manewry Strategiczna Gra Planszowa
description:
This is the two players only stategic game. Players take the role of the army general and maneuver their land units. Terrain on the map limits units' moves and impacts their powers.

Goal:
Using the land units generals try to:
1. eliminate all enemy units
OR 2. imprison the enemy leader
OR 3. conquer the enemy leader's starting point.

Warships is a straightforward game. There is no random element here. It is only two players, two armies.

name: Eagle Leader: Expansion #2 – Hellenic Air Force
description:
The pilots of the Hellenic Air Force were charged with defeating the Soviet Black Sea Fleet. With a mix of American aircraft from across three generations of jet fighters (Including the F-102 Delta Dagger, the A-7H Corsair II, and the F-16 ), the Greeks had their work cut out for them.

This set adds 54 cards and 48 counters to your Eagle Leader game, including:


42 x Aircraft cards (F-4E / F-5 / F-16C / F-102 / A-7H)
12 x Target cards
4 x Skill counters
1 x Pilot Skills sheet
3 x Campaign sheets


-description from publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Eagle Leader: Expansion #3 – Italian Air Force
description:
During the 1980s, the Italian Air Force was one of the most capable in NATO. Flying the Panavia Tornado IDS, as well as the A-11 Ghibli and older aircraft such as the G. 91, the Italian Air Force found itself split between helping the Greeks on the Mediterranean front and NATO in Germany. The Italian Air Force also fought the Libyans and Syrians. Take to the skies with the Italian Air Force and face all new foes as you fight to stop the crushing onslaught of global communism!

This set adds 54 cards and 32 counters to your Eagle Leader game, including:


45 x Aircraft cards (Tornado IDS / F-104S / G-91 / G-19Y / AMX A-11Bs)
3 x Target cards
4 x Event cards
2 x Special Condition cards
9 x Skill counters
1 x Pilot Skills sheet
3 x Campaign sheets


-description from publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Eagle Leader: Expansion #6 – Aces
description:
The iconic USAF fighter pilot dominates the idea of what a fighter pilot should be. In the Eagle Leader Aces pack, you’ll gain the ability to take legendary aces into your squadron. This set adds 54 cards and 54 counters to your Eagle Leader game, including:


54 x Aircraft cards (F-15C / F-15E Strike Eagle / F-16C / F-16 ADF / F-4G Wild Weasel / F-111F / A-4D)


-description from publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Eagle Leader: Expansion #7 – Experimental Aircraft
description:
As the enemy advances, prototypes are hurriedly rushed into battle, while trainers and aggressor units are drafted for frontline work. The Experimental Aircraft pack offers a speculative, "what if?" designs which never made it past the design stage in real-life, allowing you to take some of these cutting-edge, innovative aircraft into action. This set adds 56 cards and 58 counters to your Eagle Leader game, including:


54 x Aircraft cards (F-15 STOL / F-16XL / F-18 HARV / F-20 Tigershark / AST-21 Tomcat / F-29 / X-31 / F-21 Lion / Mirage G)
2 x Event cards


-description from publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Glasses Girls Collection
description:
Glasses Girls Collection is a may follow trick-taking game. In the game, players are attempting to collect cards from a deck showing girls with glasses.

For each trick, one glasses card will be revealed for each of the game's three suits; the person who plays the highest card of that suit will win that glasses card. However, if a player already has a matching glasses card, the two cards are discarded.

The game also includes a wild suit and other rules.

The game ends when either one player has collected 5 types of glasses cards or everyone has 1 card left in their hand. In either case, the player with the most types of glasses cards wins.

name: Back O' Beyond: Tales of Blood & Salt
description:
Deep within the vast blue and grey of the sea and the endless storm lies a long-forgotten land. Stories tell of a safe passage within the roaring belly of the ocean. Legends tell that hiding behind rocks, clouds, and the unforgiving force of the sea lies an island, an island that pirates call home, a place where dreaded captains spend their downtime trading in the marketplace, drinking spiced rum in the tavern, testing their reputation at the Council Hall, or mingling in mischief in the Back Alley.

Seek infamy and become the most dreaded pirate captain! Create a powerful ship by carefully selecting and managing your crew, do battle and plunder ships full of loot, and make a fortune that no living man has ever made! And when you're tired, come back to the only land you feel is safe for you to rest and get ready for your next adventure. What treasures will you find? How many ships will you capture? Will your crew look up to you or start a mutiny? Will the sound of your name bring fear? There’s only one way to find out...

Back O' Beyond is a highly thematic mid-weight 2-4 player euro game that takes around 30 minutes per player to complete. In the game, you take the role of a pirate captain, and your goal is to become the most renowned pirate, that is, the one with the most prestige points.

The game is played over five rounds, and each round consists of three phases. To start, new contracts that pirates compete over are revealed, the tavern is filled with potential crew, ships that can be captured arrive, and players repair or upgrade their ships...and possibly sabotage others. Next, by using a dice-based combat system, players attempt to plunder trading ships to gather precious loot and raise their dread, morale, reputation, and (most importantly) infamy. To end the round, players decide who to keep or dismiss from their crew through the power of food, morale, and rum.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, End Game Bonuses, Events, Income, Market, Selection Order Bid, Take That, Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Eagle Leader: Expansion #8 – Japan Air Self-Defense Force
description:
The east is red in this expansion featuring aircraft of the Japan Air Self-Defense Force! With aircraft such as the F-4EJ, F-104J and F-15J, this set opens up a whole new front in the Pacific theatre! This set adds 56 cards and 88 counters to your Eagle Leader game, including:


45 x Aircraft cards (F-4EJ Kai / F-4EJ / F-15J / F-104J / F-1)
11 x Target cards
27 x Bushido counters
16 x Skill counters
3 x Campaign sheets


—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: 9Peak
description:
9Peak is an abstract game about collecting hats. Players are dealt a hand of numbered cards, and gradually play cards from their hand in order to predict the highest possible scoring sets. The cards on the board increase the “value range” of a particular number, allowing the player to aim for a higher hand.

The game ends when all the cards in the hand have been played out, and the player with the highest total of cards wins the game!

name: Dinosaur-Shaped Money Pot
description:
Players try to break the money pot, the player to achieve that goal wins.

During a turn a player spins the spinner, which tell the player to throw some coins into the dinosaur, smash it with the hammer or both. After some number of hits the dino breaks and the money fall out.

name: Shits & Sausages
description:
THE CARDS:
A 56 card pack is used

GOAL:
The goal is to win all of the cards and the loser must clean the toilet.

TO DEAL:
Shuffle and deal out all the cards face down, one at a time, beginning to the dealer's left. Each player puts their cards in a pile, face down in front of them.

PLAY EASY
The game begins with each player in turn flipping over the card, creating a new centre pile with the cards face up.
When two identical cards are flipped over consecutively, the players who placed the matching cards must call out "shits" or "sausages" determined by the imagery on the card. The lucky player who calls out first correctly takes the centre pile of cards, adding them to the bottom of their own face down pile.
The ultimate winner is the player who ends up with all the cards.

PLAY HARD
The game begins with each player in turn flips over the card on top of their deck in front of them, creating a new deck with the cards face up.
When two identical cards are flipped over consecutively, the players who placed the matching cards must call out "shits" or "sausages" determined by the imagery on the card. The lucky player who correctly calls out first takes the oppositions pile of face up cards, adding them to the bottom of their own face down pile.
If the cards placed down are matching but a player shouts incorrectly, the opposing player wins that round, taking the
face up cards. For example, if the player calls out "shits" when being faced with a pair of cards showing "sausages" they lose that round.
When all the cards in a pile are face up, the player turns over the pile and starts again.
If two players correctly call out "shits" or "sausages" simultaneously, everyone's pile of face-up cards are placed in the centre as one pile.
When two identical cards are turned over and match a card already face-up on the centre pile, the first person who calls out "double shits" or "double sausages" wins the centre pile.
The game continues with each player in turn flipping over the card on top of their deck in front of them again. The ultimate winner is the player who ends up with all the cards.

—description from the designer

name: Fog of Love: Pride 2022 Promo – Walk the Runway
description: Promo card: How do you react to your partner’s Pride outfit choice?

name: Pction SIingems real game
description:
Pction SIingems real game is the official bootleg version of the game PotionSlingers. It plays the exact same as the original but contains inconsistencies and printing errors, mistranslated mechanics, downgraded components and lopsided gameplay.

Contains two booster packs of characters and items from the real game, but the printing material is different and the tarot cards are poker sized.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Market, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Miracle Ticket
description:
In Miracle Ticket players become jam band parking lot Wooks who are racing to find the elusive "miracle ticket" that gets them into the show for free.

Players utilize "buzz" cards (acid, shrooms, nitrous, nugs, edibles, molly) to move themselves or another player forward on a path that ends at the entrance to the music venue. Veggie burrito cards a defense against being "dosed" by another player and can alternately allow a player to move backward 1 space. The path is littered with beneficial, neutral and penalty spaces which will inform which player to dose.

The Miracle Ticket is located halfway along the path and held by whichever player is in the lead. The winner is the first player to reach the venue with Miracle Ticket in hand.

—description from the designer

name: Droga: Duże puzzle z grą
description:
Build your dream road from puzzle pieces! Create a track up to 3 meters long, plan where the car park and gas station will be, and race to the finish line!

Automotive enthusiast on board? Let him spark his imagination, create routes of his own design and become a master of the steering wheel in the race around the city.

Droga: Duże puzzle z grą (direct translation: Road. Large puzzle pieces with the game) will appeal to the youngest who love to build their own constructions. The elements can be combined in any order, using all, part of the road, or even several sets of puzzles.

Decide where the START and where the FINISH will be and where to place the signals. Plan the location of the gas station and parking lot. The fun never ends, because each time you can arrange the pieces in a different configuration. Route ready? We're off to the race!

After laying out the route, players choose one of the attached cars or use their toy cars. They take turns rolling the dice, moving the cars by the designated number of spaces. The one who finishes the race first wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Cold Case Box: Caso Russel
description:
On the night of March 3, 2014, former gardener Brad Russell was hit on the back of the head with a golf club by one of three neighbors. But which of the 3?

As a team, you will need to analyse letters, interpret the police interviews of various suspects.
You will all work together in a team, rather than playing against one another.

—user summary

La notte del 3 marzo 2014, l’ex giardiniere Brad Russell viene colpito alla nuca con una mazza da golf da uno dei tre vicini. Ma quale dei 3?

—description from the publisher

name: Можно ваш телефончик? (Can I get your phone?)
description:
Get ready your phones
Now you will send all kinds of stuff to your friends, subscribers and random people from your phone book. It will be awkward, but funny.

Each turn, you roll a die and move your pawn as many spaces as you get. Then you take on the task. Perform it - leave the chip where it is. Merge - move it back.
On tasks, you will call or text to your contacts, sometimes post something on social networks. The tasks are shameful and provocative, the game will not be gentle with you and will set the heat. The one who reaches the finish line first wins. And will not burn with shame.

name: Mały odkrywca: Cyferki – Gra edukacyjna
description:
Cyferki ("Digits") is a didactic puzzle for preschoolers, which familiarizes children with digits and numbers in a friendly way. Thanks to this educational game, children learn to count, train memory, stimulate imagination and expand their abilities.

—description from the publisher

In this game one player manages the stack of tiles by revealing one after another. The tiles feature either a number or a group of animals. Whenever any player sees that there are two matching tiles (the number on a tile matches the number of animals on other tile) they shout "mine!" and take this pair as a reward. When the stack is depleted the player that gathered most tiles wins.

—user summary
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Number, Real-time

name: In den Händen der Raubritter
description:
One player, the robber baron, commands ten black knights, which start at the castle. The other players get a grocer's cart and for guards and start in the corner of their color. Their goal is to get their cart to the opposite corner of the game board, while the black knights try to kill the guards to capture the cart.

The players take turns to move. The robber baron moves last. The knights and guards may move one space in any direction or jump over other knights, guards or carts. The carts may move only on the white and brown spaces in all directions but do not jump. They have to keep contact to at least one guard. The dark green spaces may not be entered by any figure.

Enemy figures are eliminated by jumping over them. The black knights capture a cart if they isolate it from the guards or kill all guards.

The players get coins for saving or capturing a cart. The player with the most coins after an agreed on number of games is the winner.

—user summary

name: Supermarket Race
description:
Get ready to race around the supermarket! This game uses 2 surprise Mini Brands Collectables as movers around the game board. Be the first to find 3 Mini Brands matching card sets; it won't be that easy though, the game is constantly in shift!

—description from the back of the box

The folding gameboard has six spaces. Players take turns moving one space each turn, then performing the action listed on the space: 'Draw three cards'; 'Steal a random card from opponent's hand'; 'Draw one card then play one card'; etc. The cards are a mix of Brand cards and Action cards. Use the Action cards in combination with the space instructions to block your opponent and increase your hand of Brands, but be careful not to exceed the seven-card hand limit. The object is to be the first to collect three sets of three of the same Brand cards.

—user summary

name: test board game with version
description: Test description

name: Test game with weblink
description: Test. Testing.

name: Defenders of the Dictionary
description:
You may notice that your daily communications are filled with slang, shorthand, and emojis, which are often auto-corrected by predictive technology. Thankfully, there is a task force dedicated to celebrating and preserving the richness of our language.

Your mission, as a defender of the dictionary, is to protect the diversity of language from the forces that seek to oversimplify it. Armed with your collective wisdom, you must use your words to navigate the city and stop the villains from diminishing the beauty of language. After all, knowledge is power, and it must be cherished.

In Defenders of the Dictionary, players will cooperate to navigate the city of Wordopolis via letter-and-grid-based wordplay. For each mission, you need to achieve a specific task and follow particular direction with your words before running out of turns. Completing a mission helps you gain valuable intel about the villains and advances your campaign.

Defenders of the Dictionary takes the familiar gameplay of grid-based word games and flips it on its head. You will need to collaborate within together within this system, navigate specific directions, and overcome the challenges and obstacles set by the villains.

The campaign is composed of with many short games where each game represents a mission. Each mission may include some new and some previously introduced mechanisms. The campaign is designed with gamer group flexibility in mind so it's not necessary to play every mission with the same group of people. Complete all the missions to determine which villain was the mastermind, and face-off with them in the final showdown.

-description from designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Connections, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Coverage, Hand Management, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Spelling, Tile Placement

name: Grocery Grab Game
description:
Put your reflexes to the test in the Mini Brands Grocery Grab head-to-head card game! It's going to take your keen eye and quick reflexes to win this game. Flip cards and look for matching colors or brands. When you see one, be the first player to grab the Mini Brands Collectable and score one token. Keep flipping and grabbing to score enough tokens to win!

This Mini Brands card game includes your favorite grocery store products straight from the shelf such as Kraft Macaroni and Cheese and Country Time Lemonade but in teeny tiny form. Don't forget your Mini Brands collectable that comes with this card game. Hershey's Syrup - your favorite topping to put in milk, on ice cream, or just eat by the spoonful- comes in the smallest form you've ever seen! This game is fun for kids and adults alike. It makes the perfect stocking stuffer, fidget toy, or gift item for the collector in your life. Plus, it might just make your kids excited to go on that grocery store errand with you next time.

-description from publisher's website

name: Secret Game
description:
The dazzling world of SM is recreated in a card game,
Can you make 10 beautiful women your mistresses by captivating them with your pleasure and abuse?

—description from the back of the box (translated)

A trainer brings beautiful young girls into a world of dazzling pleasures.
As one of these trainers, you will torture them with a variety of techniques such as bondage, whipping, enema, and anal sex.
How many beautiful women you will be able to make captive of SM and make them your mistress depends on your technique.

—description from the rulebook (translated)

At the end of the game, the player who have most beautiful girls card wins.

—user summary

めくるめくSMの世界をカードゲームで再現、
貴方は10人の美女たちを快楽と被虐の虜にして愛奴とすることができるか。

—description from the back of the box

name: Mot i Brøstet Spillet
description:
Join the famous actors from the TV series "Mot i Brøstet" through various crazy situations. The first of three games based on the show.
The players get a piece each connected with one of the characters from the show; Nils, Trine, Målfrid, Karl or Henry. The players roll dice and travel through the game board representing a trip from the characters home during breakfast, and further on through the town of Oslo, then Las Palmas, and finally back home. Some of the spaces have specific events that happens to whoever lands on them, ranging from moving to other spaces, losing or gaining a turn or being sent to alternative paths through the board. These spaces all have small stories including the characters from the show explaining the result. First player to the last space wins.

name: Don't Drop the Soap: Gefängnisdirektor
description:
A Promocard from Spiel Essen 2021.

Text from the card:
Durchsuche das Deck nach 1 Karte deiner Wahl und gib sie einem anderen Spieler. Mische anschließend das Deck.

(Search through the deck for one card of your choice and give it to another player. Then, shuffle the deck.)

name: Moving Castle
description:
Moving Castle is an abstract board game, reminiscent of Chess, where there are two goals, the first to Capture the rival Moving Castle, or to reach the Opponent's Starting Rank with your Moving Castle. The Moving Castle Moves like a King in Chess, but has an area of Influence equal to a Queen. Pieces that lie within that range gain Special Effects, powers that improve and allow them to do greater things.

The Moving Castle itself has two Lives, a Piece that Captures its first Life is immediately destroyed instead. A Turn consists of Moving two separate Pieces, then Moving the Moving Castle.

There are also three States: Aggressive, Passive, Passive-Aggressive. For Aggressive, you are forced to Move a single Piece twice, and are required to Capture with the second Move. You may not Capture the Moving Castle using Aggressive State. Passive is the default State, the only "power" is to allow a single Movement in a Turn, instead of two Actions. Passive-Aggressive is the most interesting one, basically in exchange for not Moving, whenever an Opponent Piece comes into range of your Piece in this State, it automatically Captures, as a free Move. This might mean however, your Piece is forced to lure out.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Grid Movement, Interrupts, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Square Grid, Zone of Control

name: Gdzie ktyje się magia? Bitwa, gra karciana: My Little Pony
description: It is played with cards depicting characters from the series My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic. Each character has numerical values for traits such as: height, magic, friendliness, mischief and beauty. All cards are dealt. The player who starts takes the first blind card from his pile and chooses which Trait will be resolved. Then all players reveal their cards from the top of the pile. The player with the highest stat wins, takes all the cards, and starts the next turn. The game ends when one player gets all the cards.

name: Energize Duel
description:
In Energize Duel, every player embodies a superhero and engages in thrilling battles to determine the mightiest, swiftest, or most clever hero of all.

As they traverse the room, players challenge one another through the use of Duel cards.

By triumphing in quick duels, like rock-paper-scissors, thumb wrestling, or trying to evoke laughter from the opponent, players claim their opponents cards.

Ultimately, the player who claims the greatest number of cards emerges victorious.

Energize Duel can be played in workshops, as a team building exercise or with friends/family.

—description from the designer

name: Federal Disintegration: Russia
description:
Comrade Gov’nor, welcome to this game of lies, deceit, corruption and murder. You are to navigate the murky waters of the upper-echelon of the Russian policy while ruling over your oblasts. You start your political journey under the watchful eye of Moscow oblast - which is a Non-Player-Character.
You will have access to riches beyond your wildest dreams, directly out of the bosom of Mother Russia: timber, oil, steel, gold, diamonds and, of course… potato. Spend them wisely to acquire power, because yachts are an impoundable illusion. You will gain resources in each turn, but half of everything goes to Moscow. Play your hand close to the chest and take maximum advantage of both alliances and traitors. When the time is right, you will be able to declare your independence and from then on, ALL of the riches stay in your regional budget. Moscow, of course, will try to ”denazify” you and ”liberate” your province from under your rule as soon as possible - so choose your timing wisely.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Modern Warfare, Political, Territory Building
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Events, Movement Points

name: Hyperspace: Thoth
description:
Each Hyperspace expansion civilization comes with a Homeworld tile, 4 unique Citizens, 2 Super Units, and 2 Super Techs.

A death-obsessed species, the Thoth’s powerful psychic curses blight and hamper other players, and often lead to violence. Meanwhile they benefit from the glories of oblivion, firm in their knowledge of their complicated afterlife.

The Sphinx super-ship is a light-sail, which elegantly swings through space at the minimum energy cost needed. It is built of so-called “resurrected matter”, a highenergy form of normal matter. As such it is indestructible by normal weapons, though the attached devices and sensors on the Sphinx’s outside surface can of course be burned off and need re-affixing.

name: Hyperspace: Vorck
description:
Each Hyperspace expansion civilization comes with a Homeworld tile, 4 unique Citizens, 2 Super Units, and 2 Super Techs.

The Vorck have a strong work ethic and never lack for resources. They love to build alongside other civs and this booms the Vorck economy. Eventually they can turn those extra resources into a terrifying fleet incorporating the dreaded ramships. The Vorck have no strong instinct for battle. To them, war is just another industrial project. Most of their weapons are converted tools. Instead of blasters, their troops carry overclocked welding torches. Instead of sergeants and officers, they have foremen and supervisors.

Their super-ship, the Ram, is a converted wrecker. The back half of the ship is the “real” vessel, basically just a small control compartment and huge engines. On the front is a powerful magnetic clamp, which the Vorck use to lock bits of flotsam and destroyed ship parts. This giant spiky surface, they then directly ram into the target enemy. Of course, the crash itself can harm the Ram, but it has done its duty.

name: Hyperspace: Yithian
description:
Each Hyperspace expansion civilization comes with a Homeworld tile, 4 unique Citizens, 2 Super Units, and 2 Super Techs.

This species is the hardest of all civs to play. Not because they are inherently complex, but because of the mindswap which adopts abilities, weaknesses, and technology of another species. They start as “vanilla” Yithians, then might become Dacians, then Xk-13, and so forth, forcing their rivals to adapt to the new situation. Of course, the Yithians must adapt too – learning or figuring out how to use their new powers.

The Yithian battleship is designed with internal nodes and weapon ports for a gigantic array of devices and systems. When they swap minds with a target species, they adapt the technology best-suited for their new bodies into the battleship, and so the battleships take on a variety of roles

name: Hyperspace: Zevolt
description:
Each Hyperspace expansion civilization comes with a Homeworld tile, 4 unique Citizens, 2 Super Units, and 2 Super Techs.

Every rival hates the Zevolt ability to strip away useful techs, which not only boosts the Zevolt but weakens their victims. You cannot even wreak vengeance with your secrets,
adding insult to injury.

Their super-unit, the Dragonship, is actually one of their national leaders. It is one of the most dreaded units in Hyperspace – its first strike capability removes enemy units
before they can even focus their cannons. The Dragonship’s one weakness is that because it cannot attack in concert with its other ships, the Zevolt tend to damage enemies rather than destroy them, and their race is actually weaker against space
monsters.

name: Hybris: Twilight in Olympus
description:
100 years after the events of Hybris, Disordered Cosmos, Ancient Greece is once again in turmoil: no Aegis remains and the Achaeans, led by Zeus, attack the last stronghold of the Eye of Nyx artifact: Troy.

But this fortress is protected by other Olympians who wish to eradicate Zeus' madness - the city of Troy must not fall! But that's without counting on the observation of this legendary war by the Mystics, who choose no side and simply watch, impassive.

Hybris, Twilight in Olympus is an epic game of area control for 2 to 6 players, scheduled for crowdfunding in 2024.

The game is played in 10 rounds, corresponding to the 10-year siege of Troy. During a turn, each player secretly programs his actions through his own game system:


The Achaeans program their actions using a card system
The Trojans program their actions using a worker placement system.
The Mystics program the potential actions of the other two players!


The action phase then starts, with the Achaean player revealing his first card, then spending a time value to carry out his action. The other players will use the Achaean's time value to carry out their actions.

The Achaeans win if Troy falls, either by breaking the wall, stealing the nyx eye, or if Troy falls economically before the 10 turns.
Trojans win if they survive 10 turns.
Mystics win if they achieve their secret objectives before either of the other two players win.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Action Timer, Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Tantrum House Roll & Write
description:
In Tantrum House Roll & Write, the numbers 2-12 are all assigned a representative game-related icon (3 = a meeple, 5 = Kevin Delp’s hat, 10 = a die, etc). Players will use the sun of two dice to place a matching icon in one of the six Tantrum House studios (3x3 grids). Scores are determined by the number of icons that match its studios icons.

This print ‘n play roll & write standalone game was part of the Tantrum House Season 10 Kickstarter campaign.

HOW TO PLAY:

Active player rolls 4 dice and chooses 2 (gaining benefits if applicable)
All other players use the result of non-chosen dice
Icon can be drawn in any box
Gain bonus icons immediately when a row or column contains 3 matching icons

name: Comploty
description:
Explore a dark, unsettling world and battle your opponents in this turn-based strategic board game in which you take on the role of a leader of a sinister secret society. Your objective is no less than to take over the world! Peppered with biting black humor, Comploty is the world's first board game based on conspiracy theories that actually exist.

You'll get to know more than one hundred conspiracy theories, from investigative revelations to creative pipe dreams to totally whacked-out and red-hot dangerous narratives, from the QAnon movement to chemtrails to the secret Nazi stronghold in Antarctica.
