Up to 8 can play. After you have punched out a rocket ship for each player (and the artwork on the playing pieces is awful), everyone has to start at Earth. You have to assemble the Spinner - oops! the Space Compass - and when it is ready, the game can start. Spin the Space Compass and move along the track towards Venus (marked with an A) the amount of spaces that you spun. There are 12 spaces in total with a letter next to them. If you land exactly on one, you must obey the instructions. The first to get back to Earth, wins.

name: Aladdin: Sounds of Fun Electronic Talking Board Game
description:
Join Aladdin's adventure as he tries to rescue sweet Princess Jasmine from the hourglass where the villain Jafar holds her prisoner.

Players press the center button on the Sound Randomizer board, following the instructions given. The aim of the game is to collect Magic Carpet chips which are needed to combat Jafar. Players have 4 chances to battle Jafar. If he wins each battle, he turns into the evil genie and wins the game. If a player defeats Jafar, that player wins the game.
categories: Arabian, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Glory
description: Glory embodies a new, fresh experience in bible study and Christian living. The object of the game is to enter “glory” and be with the Lord.

name: An American Tail: Fievel Goes West
description: Help Fievel travel from New York to Green River. But watch out there are dangers awaiting him as he travels to the old west.
categories: American West, Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Pocahontas Pick A Peck Game
description:
The object is to be the first player to get all your food into your basket.

place 3 turkeys into your basket
Turn the spinner and do what it indicates e.g.
1 or 2 turkeys: Take 1 or 2 from your basket (if there are still any) and put them into the centre - they will stay there until game ends
1- 4 food: take appropiate amount from your green area into your basket
- you can't fill up your basket to maximum (12) until you've got rid of all your turkeys -
2 hungry kids: eat 2 food - place 2 food out of your basket back into your garden
you win after you've filled up your basket (12 food)

name: Getcha
description: Getcha is an exciting adult game of skill and fun. Getcha tests your drinking ability as well as your skill and luck. To win the game a player must collect six Getcha cards, which spell the G-E-T-C-H-A.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Fish Stories
description: Enjoy fishing — or card playing? Then you'll love playing Fish Stories — an exciting and educational fishing card game. No need to tell a "fish story" about the one that got away — get them all here. Ice fish for Northern Pike, Muskellunge..., fly-cast for Trout, Bass, Salmon..., dive for Oysters, Scallops or Abalone, surf cast for Bluefish, Striped Bass, troll for Tarpon, Marlin, Shark—and drift-chum for the Great White Shark. But watch out for the Boot! 25 of the most sought after fish in the U.S.A. 64 cards in all — beautifully illustrated by noted nature artist Ron Dilg. Hours of fun for 1-6 players, Ages 9 and up. A new 'real-life' fishing card game...

name: The Whole Megillah
description: A card game celebrating the fun and excitement of Purim. Each card beautifully designed with meaningful detail that brings to life the people and symbols of Purim. The Whole Megillah can be played in a number of ways to create a fun and exciting game every time you play. Complete rules and variations included along with the Story of Purim.

name: Musical Attractions
description: Music titles and music trivia from the 1900's through the 1980's all in this challenging musical match game.

name: Carry On Camping Trivia Game
description: Each player or team tries to correctly answer as many questions as possible, in order to be the first to advance from the start and around the playing board back to the finish.

name: Run Dinosaur Run
description: The race is on. But there's danger ahead, the lava is hot, the cavemen are cranky and the Rex is hungry. Who will be the first dinosaur to reach paradise palms?
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Riddle Game
description: The first player to collect the 6 letter cards R,I,D,D,L,and E by landing on those letter spaces and answering the riddles correctly will become the wizard of riddles, and the winner of the riddle game.
categories: Children's Game, Humor, Memory, Word Game

name: The Business Week Game
description: Business is like a jigsaw puzzle. That's why executives read Business Week - so they can see the whole business picture. That's how you win The Business Week Game. The object is to complete the interlocking picture puzzle on your right-hand side of the board. The player who gets the whole business picture first in the winner.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Dr. Tangle
description: When Dr. Tangle makes a house call, he gives everybody a big dose of fun with his wild and wacky game. Players take turns being Dr. Tangle, calling out Doctor's Orders from the tangle cards. The Doctor tries to get everybody so tangled up, they break the ropes tying them together in a circle. The player who does the best job of breaking up his or her friends scores the most points and wins the game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Point to Point Movement

name: Scramble Jamble
description:
Part of the Bicycle Kids children's games from USPC.
Players have to collect sets comprising of three cards. A correct set will consist of a Head, a Body and the Feet (so the child can form a correct and complete image of the character).
publishers: The United States Playing Card Company

name: Hexa
description: Hexa: Derwin Playing Cards with Hexadecimal Power (base 16). This is a modified standard deck of cards using base 16. There are 64 cards in the deck in four suits, plus two jesters. It includes rules for several traditional card game variants, including poker, rummy, bridge, old maid, cribbage, blackjack and more. Among the blurbs on the package: "Educational & Entertaining"; "Challenge your Math Skills"; "May be used with a Scientific Calculator".

name: Grid Iron
description: Grid Iron is the new, fast paced, action packed football game played with eight dice. With Grid Iron, you will not only be transformed into the Quarterback barking out the plays, but also the Coach, the Receiver and the Fullback barreling ahead for that First Down. You'll also get to make great defensive plays, like flying in as the Safety to make a leaping stab at the ball, or as the Linebacker coming in to make a crushing stop on the ball carrier. Grid Iron is an easy game to learn. Yet the combination of strategy, skill and luck makes every game played a pressure cooker. So if you can stand the pain, get ready to knock heads with the best of them for hours of fun and competition. Game includes eight dice, playing field, five game markers, score pad and instructions.
publishers: Partier's Pursuit, Inc., The Game Works, Inc.

name: Australian Grand Prix
description: In Formula One Grand Prix Racing, the drivers' outcome is determined by his/her abilities of skill and judgment combined with elements of luck and fate. These same factors have been integrated into the Australian Formula One Grand Prix board game. Characteristics of actual Formula One race cars, tracks, teams, and sponsors have been included so that the game may be interesting as well as informative. You will surely experience the thrills and some disappointments that make Grand Prix racing so exciting!

name: Tick Tack Math
description: TICK TACK MATH does for arithmetic what word games do for vocabulary. It is quickly learned and easily played, combining a mixture of strategy and luck. TICK TACK MATH is played on a board using numerical cards. Cards are dealt to both players and to the board. Players take turns making combinations of cards from their hands to match the board's cards. Colored chips are placed on board cards that have been matched. The first player to cover three in a row (across, down or diagonally) wins the game.TICK TACK MATH is challenging, suspenseful sic, thought-provoking FUN for children and ADULTS. It's an ideal parent-child game.

name: Chag Sameach
description: A game (primarily for preschoolers) that teaches children about Passover, Sukkos, Shavuos, and the High Holy Days. The game can be played on two different levels, for older and younger children. Options permit it to be a simplistic card-matching game, or a more advanced memory game with different options for playing.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Religious

name: Around the Jewish Year: The Game That Takes "A Year" To Play!
description: A board game that takes its players on an informative journey through the Jewish calendar, replete with the holidays, festivals, and days of mourning. Merit cards, gift cards and puzzle pieces add to the excitement of this tour of the Jewish year.

name: College: The Game of Knowledge
description: College: The Game of Knowledge puts you to the test with questions in nine different subjects including History, Literature, Geography, Art, Music, General Science, Chemistry, Physics and Biology. Choose your curriculum (liberal arts or science) and you are on your way to hours of fun. First player to complete his curriculum by answering all required subjects is the winner.

name: Doug Loser Proof Matching Transforming Game
description: Doug Funnie wants to be anything but average. In this game, you can make him Loser Proof. Find a matching pair of Doug's friends and put a Loser Proof card over part of Doug's picture. After 10 matches, Doug's new picture is complete. Now, he's Loser Proof and you're the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Butterflies and Flowers
description: Object is to cover the flowers on the card with butterflies.

name: Lost in Time
description: Are you ready for an interplanetary time-traveling treasure hunt?! Everyone loses things now and then, but what do we do when we FIND something? Now, you and your family can learn the halachos of hashavas aveidah, returning lost objects, while having loads of fun!

name: Mitzvah La-Chag Memory Game
description: This memory game contains 20 durable playing pieces that feature pictures of Judaica and holiday-related objects. It consists of sets of interlocking pieces, and encourages players to hone their knowledge of Jewish holidays and customs, by requiring them to piece together the objects that come together--ie. a Shofar and an apple for Rosh Hashanah.

name: Mitzvah Millionaire
description: The board game of Jewish values where players learn to take every opportunity to use money to do chesed, give tzedakah, and perform mitzvos, while encouraging others to do the same. Three challenging levels of questions.

name: Number Won
description: A game of number knowledge, strategy and fun! Answer number questions, put down your piece, and fly across the board--if your opponent doesn't push you off first!

name: Shabbat Shalom Game
description: This card game contains beautiful, hand-drawn pictures of things used for Shabbat: Kiddush cup, challos, a havdalah set, and Shabbat candles. The object of the game is to get a match of four identical cards.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Religious

name: The Kids Speak Game
description: Based on the all-time bestsellers, The Kids Speak Series by Chaim Walder. This game teaches valuable lessons and gets players thinking about their lives and others. This game teaches integral values including respect for others, giving charity, doing good deeds, and guarding one's tongue.

name: The Super Siddur Search
description: Hurry around the game board looking for the prayers and blessings you need to complete your very own Siddur, in this charming game that teaches about the prayers, customs, laws, and blessings that make up the Siddur. The game provides opportunities for singing, telling stories, and recalling previously learned facts.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Singing, Storytelling

name: Get Ready, Get Set, Good Shabbos!
description:
Players travel through town filling their bags with food. Mitzvos wait around every corner in this educational game.

From the publisher:
Preparing for Shabbos has never been so much fun! Players travel through town filling their bags with food, and their hearts with a love for Shabbos.

name: Letter Getter: The Jewish Rummy Game
description: Traditional Rummy with a Hebrew twist! Form words and match up letter-tiles which come in Aleph Beis script, Rashi script, print, and gematria. Answer questions on the laws of Shabbos to collect prize-tokens and you'll find out just what your word's worth! A bilingual game on two levels.

name: Letter Getter Junior
description: This junior edition of Letter Getter is specifically designed so that parents and children can learn Alef-Beis letters together. Game contains two sets each of print and script Alef-Beis letters and suggestions for many creative ways to play and learn.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Religious, Word Game

name: Over and Over
description: This is a game of brachos (blessing) matching. Players must match coins depicting different foods, back-to-back with foods of the same brachah, creating towers, while racing against fellow players. Alternatively, players can arrange their coins in order of the brachos said on them.

name: The Young Maccabees
description: Join the Young Maccabees and experience the thrills and miracles on their quest to liberate Jerusalem.

name: Telephone Trivia
description: Players must correctly answer questions to move their piece around the board. Once a player returns to their home corner, they move to the center telephone dial where they must correctly answer seven questions to win the game.

name: Darkwing Duck
description: The Not-So-Good Guys are hiding out in the cards in your hand. Be the first player to capture one of each of the Not-So-Good Guys out of your (or an opponent's) hand and play it on the table in front of you, and you win - maybe.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Movie Mania for Kids
description: Take this travel-size movie mania for kids with you wherever you go to entertain your junior traveling companions. Players take turns drawing cards containing movie trivia from children's movies. The player who answers the question correctly keeps the card. The first player to possess three cards from both categories wins.
categories: Card Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: I'm the Brain
description: Players compete to advance their tokens through the various points of achievement pictured throughout the game. To win, a player must be the first to advance all of his tokens into the Success circle. Patents are acquired and royalties are thereafter collected. Special privileges and penalties are encountered during play, which enliven and enhance interest in the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Turn Turtle
description:
Mix all the Turtles (letters down) leaving them on the table within reach of all players. The Turtles are then in the "POOL". To decide who plays first, each player selects on Turtle. Lowest alphabetically plays first. Turtles are then returned to the "POOL".

In turn, each player selects any five Turtles from the "POOL" and without looking at the letters places them Turtle head forward on the shelf of the TURN-TURTLE (tile stand). The TURN-TURTLE is then tipped and pushed slowly forward by the player thus flipping the TURTLES onto the table and revealing the 5 letters which were selected.

The player tries to get the most points possible from each turn by arranging any or all of the five letters so that they spell different words. Add the letter value of each word to make the total score value for each turn. Bonus points are scored if the letters don't need to be rearranged or if a five letter word can be scored.

After each player's turn, score the total, return all five Turtles to the "POOL" (letters down) mix and pass the TURN-TURTLE to the next player to the left.

From the rule book:
A new, exciting word-game combining luck, imagination and spelling vocabulary.

Turn Turtle is played on any smooth surface.

The object of the game is to get the highest total score by forming words.

Each player has the same number of turns during a game.

name: The Warden
description: Players answer questions about safety, crime and law, drugs and scenarios in order to collect puzzle pieces to form the key picture. The first player to correctly answer 9 questions thus completing the key puzzle is the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Metromania
description:
Metromania is an educational board game that blends chance, strategy, knowledge and logic. The game consists of historical and cultural information about New York City and features nearly 20,000 facts contained in 3,600 questions and answers that thoroughly portray the uniqueness of Manhattan, the Bronx, Brooklyn, Queens and Staten Island.
The object of the game is to leave the base of the Statue of Liberty and be the first player to arrive at the top of the Empire State Building.
mechanics: Memory, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Italian Chatter
description:
Players compete to collect word tiles to complete a phrase in Italian. Chatter has two aims: first to produce a winner (the player who collects the most word-tiles) and second, to allow the players to understand and remember foreign words and phrases.

The contents of this game are: 40 illustrated phrase-cards, 4 sets of color coded word tiles, 6 phrase cards and word tile holders, 1 game bag, 1 translation master key and 1 set of rules.

Intellect released four "Chatter" games - Italian, Spanish, German & French.

name: Code Master: Secret Agent
description:
Enemies from the evil empire of Nastonia are invading the country.

Read the book to find the hidden numbers, then open the lock and enter the secret world of spies. Challenge your skills with brain benders, quests, maps and missions. As you explore this top secret adventure, you'll move up the ranks from cadet to full-fledged agent.

You have to crack a code to get to the inside hidden compartment of the book. Inside there are various missions that you can succeed in only by following instructions and completing various activities which include word puzzles and fun science projects. The only drawback is that once you solve the missions, you're done. It's not something you would do twice.

Ideal for 7 year-olds or younger (say, to age 4). Kids will love the locked box because you can reset the combinatiuon code and it will be a truly secret place that only they can enter.
categories: Book, Children's Game, Puzzle, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Retro
description:
[From the back cover]
RETRO is a lively and interactive team game suitable for four or more players, aged twelve and over.

Based on the collections of London's three major art galleries, there are over two hundred cards with questions and answers on artists, art history, works of art or art techniques.

In your turn, you pick up a card and read the question out loud to your team, reading the answer silently to yourself.

If your team mates cannot immediately answer the question, you may prompt them by hastily sketching clues using the pencil and pad provided. No verbal or mimed clues are allowed.

Teams move famous masterpieces around the coloured squares of a pallet shaped board attempting to collect three of each of the primary colored cards. The first team with three blue, red and yellow cards wins the game.

name: Family Tree
description:
The cards are shuffled and placed face down on the table. Each player receives $10.000. The banker receives an additinal $10.000 for its services. Before the game starts a player can buy insurance cards. A insurance card can prevent losses on the board. Every player gets two family cards and places his/her token on the board.

The banker plays first. Each turn the player rolls the dice and moves his/her token along the board. When a player lands on a space, he/she follows the directions on the space. If a player cannot follow the directions, he/she is out of the game.
A family tree in this game consists of one female family card and one male family card from the 1600's, 1700's, 1800's and 1900's. Your fortune is built by landing on various spaces on the board. Additional family cards are collected when a player passes start. The family cards can be changed by 2 for 1 card. The cards are kept secret from the other players.

Players win or lose money from various spaces and the fortune cards. The first player to complete an 8 card family tree and build a fortune of $100,000 becomes the winner.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Music Maestro II
description:
Music Maestro II is a diverse series of games that introduces players to musical instruments of the West. Forty-eight instruments, early and modern, are featured in five different games for players aged 4 and up. Game materials include:

- Game Board with 48 color illustrations of instruments arranged in an orchestral setting
- 48 Instrument Cards, one for each instrument box on the game board
- 47 Conductor Cards, each describing an instrument
- 13 Ensemble Cards, each giving the number and name of the ensemble group and the names and illustration of the instruments in the group
- 2 Cassette Tapes introduce the sounds of the instruments and challenge players to recognize sounds in four different listening games

The Games:

Conductor Says - A lotto game for players aged 4 to 8. Players learn to recognize and name instruments.

Ensemble - A rummy game to teach players 9 and up instrumental groups.

Ensemble Agent - A lively combination of "Rummy 500" and "Go Fish" to further challenge two to four players 10 and up. Agent tries to "book" an instrumental group.

Instru-mental - A quiz game for two to six experienced players 10 and up to learn descriptive information about instruments.

Sound Off - Two tape cassettes present four games in which the sounds of the instruments are featured. Players are challenged to identify the instrument sounds in solo and ensemble presentations.

name: Spiel! The Game of Spontaneous Speechifying
description:
Spiel! is a game for bright, silly souls enchanted with the absurd and the odd nuances of language. It's a hilarious game which sees folks making quick, ludicrous lectures.

We've scratched out 400 speech cues that beg for your insights on American life, on topics ranging from televangelism to those fly-by-night wrestling heroes we see on late night TV. You respond by delivering impromptu, one-minute rants - and you strive to elicit laughter or gasps of surprise, or somehow impress all of your friends with the depth of your wisdom.

Spiel can be played either non-competitively or in the competitive, cut-throat spirit of capitalism. Good luck and happy Spieling!

name: Camouflage
description:
Camouflage is a card game from 1918. It consists of a deck of 56 cards. There are five cards each of nine different weapons of war: Airplane Gun, Tank, Howitzer, Mortar, Field Gun, Machine Gun, Rifle, Revolver and Bomb (hand grenade). There are 11 Camouflage cards, showing a camouflage pattern.

Each player is dealt one card. The first player is then dealt another card. If he is dealt a Camouflage card, he does not spin and play passes to the left. Otherwise, he uses the spinner, which has six results: 1, 2 and 3 places to the left and to the right. That player is the target. If that player's stack does not have a Camouflage card on top, the spinning player takes the whole stack. Either way, play passes to the left (dealing a card then using the spinner).

If a player is dealt a Howitzer card, he takes all unprotected stacks from all other players. The player with the most cards when the deck runs out wins the hand and gets 10 points. The winner of the game is the first to reach 50 points.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Wargame, World War I

name: The Last Chance
description: Seraphim Guard's first Print-It-Yourself boardgame comes at you with fists, chairs and bottles flying! In this two player game of barroom brawling as in Hollywood westerns, a group of cowboys collides with a gang of local ne'er-do-wells. Do as much damage as you can before the sheriff comes in and breaks it up! Set the abilities of your team of fighters -- but don't shoot the piano player!

name: Pile On
description: Each player gets 5 blocks. Try to stack'em, one at a time, as the moving man walks by. If a block falls down...too bad. They're yours. Be the first to pile on all your blocks and win.

name: Can You Survive Spring Break
description: A player must circle the board two times and still have money in his pockets for school books to win the game. Any player who makes a mad dash to the bathroom during the game because of sickness is automatically disqualified.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Tooth Fairy Game
description: You have lost a tooth. Put it in your backpack. Go to bed. Put the tooth under your pillow. Spin. Will the tooth fairy come? The tooth fairy is here. Like magic you've got a coin. Four coins win the game. Contains: 1 gameboard, 4 playing pieces, 16 teeth, 1 magical bed, 13 coins and one tooth fairy.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Treasure Trap
description: Try to catch the treasure before the trap catches you. Electronic burglar alarm sound with action. 2 skill levels. Retrieve most or all of the treasure to win.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Chic Chicago
description: The object of the game is to become Chicago's wealthiest individual. BUY! BUY! BUY! You've got to speculate to accumulate! Chic Chicago is equipped with one board, two dice, four tokens, branch offices and headquarter buildings, Chicago Risk Cards, Ownership Cards for each purchasable establishment, and money. (A Monopoly variant.)
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: After School
description: The bell has rung, lessons are finished and the kids are ready for fun. It's After School from Waddington’s, a quiz based game with a delightful twist designed with children (and parents) in mind. Children move around the colorfully animated board on skateboard playing pieces and discover that if they learn their ABC's and 123's there is fun to be had after school. By answering questions correctly children earn "Smart Points" that help them start a paper route, car wash, or open a lemonade stand for extra spending money. The first player to buy all the things that children like - comics, games, toys and a bike - wins the game.

name: Race to the Sun
description: You are in an interplanetary race around the solar system. The map in the center of the gameboard tracks each player's progress in the race. Space stations have been positioned along the way to mark your route. Correctly answer questions about space and blast from space station to space station. To help you answer the questions, important flight data is displayed on control panels on the sides of the gameboard.

name: Alchemy
description:
The game comes from First Quench's 'Vision 2003' customer service initiative for managers and assistants.

Most of the components in The Alchemy Set are team-building exercises in which goals are set to improve the reputation of the First Quench Brand.

However, one component is a simple game based upon snakes and ladders, where poor customer service and attitude result in going down, and good customer service and attitude result in going up.

The components are nicely produced, but the Alchemy strategy was abandoned after only a few months.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dental Floss Tycoon
description:
Congratulations, you've just started your first spooler, (it's kinda like an oil well for dental floss).

Can you out maneuver your opponents? Place tiles that help you, or hurt your opponents.

Your goal, the longest string of floss!
mechanics: Line Drawing, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Crossword Lotto
description: Word game played on a 5 x5 board, with several letters filled in. Pull letters from the box to form 5 letter words.

name: The Soap Opera Game
description: Players go around the board by rolling the dice. They attempt to collect Soap Opera ideas by landing on certain spaces and either paying off characters such as the hooker, the actress etc. and going into buildings pulling a card and following the instructions. The first player to have 2 out of the 3 following wins: 10 out of the 16 characters, 5 places visited, the most money.
categories: Dice, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Cordo
description: Cordo is a tile-placement game using small magnetic pieces on a small folding board. The pieces depict castle walls and towers, which each player tries to connect into closed fortresses. Opposing pieces can only touch each other at the corners.

name: ZOK The Jumbo Sized Fun Game
description:
Features giant vinyl playing surface and super game cards.

From the rules: "Zok is a game of Action Super Heroes. The object of the game is to be the first player to complete a comic strip on the plastic playing surface.

Contents: 48 action cards and the "Vinyl plastic playing surface"
mechanics: Area Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Vire o Poker
description: In this game, developed from dice poker, players use cards to roll the five big poker dice and make the best possible combination. Published in late 80´s by a little company, this game was largely unnoticed.

name: World IV
description: A so-called "time travel": players roll the die and move their pawns through great moments of history. Board can be fit together with World I, II, and III boards.

name: O Desafio de Shepar
description: Help the guardians of the city of Shepar, hidden in the amazonian rain forest. Collect the right pair of tiles and avoid the wrong tiles.

name: Jogo Místico
description: Players try to make their way through a number of divination methods, such as numerology, astrology, I Ching, etc. The winner can ask the oracles a question.

name: Deguello ! The War of Texan Independence
description:
From the designer: "In 1835 men from all over the world came together to a little mission located in the Mexican province of Texas. It was called the Alamo and the deeds that occurred there in early March helped to shape the destiny of the United States of America. But the Alamo was only the most famous of the battles that occurred during the Texas War of Independence. And now with Deguello you can recreate history and relive the sharp struggle for Texas independence.

By generating the scenarios for you, DEGUELLO lets you link all your combats into one long continuous story. Easy to learn game mechanics and a unique "reaction system" combine to make every game different.

Set an ambush, pursue the enemy, or defend the walls, it’s all here for you. Playable with any already based figures DEGUELLO can be played solo or with others.

The Mexican band strikes up the “Deguello”, the Spanish tune for “no quarter”. The battle is about to begin. Are you ready?"

Simple miniatures game for Texas War of Independence.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board
publishers: Rebel Minis, Two Hour Wargames (THW Game Design)

name: Lucky Chess
description:
Lucky Chess is a card-based chess variant. The cards are divided into decks based on which type of piece they apply to, and on your turn you draw one. This indicates from where (rank or file) you are allowed to move a piece, or whether or not you must make a capture.

The rules for three players involve two boards with a single White player and two Black players - White makes the same move on both boards simultaneously if possible.

name: Mindz
description:
Mindz is an abstract ostensibly themed around colored rays of light on a mirrored board, but the mechanics are not informed by this (the board is shiny, though).

Each player controls a set of pieces in different colors, with the color indicating the number of spaces it can move in a turn. Moves can be made in any combination of directions. Each player also has a black piece ("black beam of light," it says here - interesting concept) which starts the game trapped by the opponent. The object of the game is to free your black piece and bring it to your edge of the board.

Rules are included for three and four-player versions. In each two players team up, and on each team one player plays
attack and the other defense, with somewhat different rules.

name: The Ultimate Word Game
description: Players start at the beginning of the game board, and advance by correctly answering multiple choice word meaning questions found on the game's word cards. The word cards are based on dictionary meanings, world facts, and well known legends. Extra advances are made by correctly spelling the word, and stating the number of vowels in it. If the word's meaning, spelling, and vowels are all correctly answered, the player gets a bonus card. Bonus cards are multiple choice as well, and are based on synonyms or antonyms. If the bonus card is answered correctly, the player rolls the die, and may advance or retreat on the board depending on the roll. The winning player is the first one to get to the end of the game board.

name: Cardz
description:
Cardz is a set of 78 letter cards. There are three basic suits with 22 letters in each suit (one of everything except J, Q, X, and Z). There is also a wild suit which has the difficult letters, one of each vowel, and three totally wild cards.

Rules are included for a number of different games, mostly adaptations of traditional card games (there's Cardz Rummy, different versions of Cardz Poker, etc.). The game that isn't an adaptation of a card game is very similar to Upwords.

A Kidz Cardz set was also sold - this has the same deck and many of the same games, but removes the rummy and poker games and adds some simpler ones (one based on war, for example).

The background of the game is of some interest. It was invented by Hannah Cannon, a 12-year-old girl whose father formed a company to market it and managed to get a fair amount of publicity for it - Hannah was interviewed on Good Morning America and got a one-page writeup in People magazine. (Her father, Doran William Cannon, is a former screenwriter who seems to be good at promotional activities.) It was supposedly sold in places such as Waldenbooks and Bloomingdale's, but references to it are hard to find now.

name: Murder
description:
Murder is a somewhat unusual deduction game. The equipment consists of a deck of (seemingly homemade but fairly sturdy) cards and a cloth bag. The cards include a group of times, a number of opportunity cards (all identical), a group of motives (all with appropriate quotes, e.g. "Love and murder will out. - William Congreve" for the Love card), "You Are Murdered" cards, and 10 sets of actual murder cards, each set containing an alias, method, weapon, and place - for example, Archbishop, Ran Over, Car, and Avenue.

Each player gets a You Are Murdered card and a random assortment of others, and in turn takes a card and discards one into the bag. The last player in the round takes the bag and can select one of the cards, discarding the rest face up (first player then rotates).

The object of this part is to collect a 4-card murder set plus a motive, opportunity, and time. When you have these you discard You Are Murdered and the last player in the round becomes the victim when that card is pulled from the bag.

At that point the game shifts into deduction mode, with everyone trying to deduce which player was the murderer and what his or her alias, motive, and time cards are.

Unfortunately the rules go very vague at this point - questioning is totally free-form, there is no way to score (and the end doesn't come until everyone has the solution, apparently), and they don't address the issue of what happens if there is more than one murderer. However, it may be possible to invent new rules to fix these problems.

name: Hot Prospect
description: The object of the game is to find the gold mine located in the center of the town. This is accomplished when a player has made his way through Wagon Trail, Prospectors Circles and Town Path and when all of the buildings in town have had claims filed on them. At this point, the car that has been randomly selected at the beginning of the game as the only entrance to the gold mine is revealed from the bottom of the pile of mine shaft cards. The player who holds the claim to the building under which this mine shaft is located is the winner.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Box Cars
description: A move-your-peg race game with a general train theme. 2 D6 control your movement and special rolls confer special powers. Similar to Sorry but instead of a board, the game is played on bright colored interlocking plastic train pieces.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Brummi Rennen
description:
The player rolls the blue dice and tries to pull one, two or three big building blocks out of the bag.
Then he rolls the natural colored dice to move the lorry and deliver the building blocks to the construction site of the corresponding color. At each construction site, every player has an own place to put the delivered blocks at.
Who will deliver the longest row of building blocks?

name: Quameleon
description: Strategic, chess-like board game. The fields on the board determine the strength of your Quameleon pawns. One must try and conquer the king.

name: Cars & Ships
description:
This is a child’s first game. It is a simple game, where the game element is as minimal as possible.

Throw the dice and move your cars and ships according to the color on the dice to the next similar colored flower or fish.

name: Parcours
description:
Game of luck and a little planning. The rulebook provides various rules for this game, to enjoy many levels of playing fun.

Aim of the game is to find the fastest route for your car from one house to the other. But beware, on your way you might get stuck in a traffic jam, get stopped by a traffic light or will have to wait while some construction is going on right in front of you.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Max & Michi
description: Max & Michi is a memory like game in which you must try and find all the right pieces of Max or Michi, with the help of a color dice.

name: Tresoro
description: Memory game. There is a treasure hidden on the bottom of the ocean. Peel of the layers of air and land, and find the matching treasure chests.

name: Witchcraft
description: Once upon a time in a far far away land the witches once a year would come together on a secret spot in the forest to search for ingredients for their magical potions. In dong so they must fly with their brooms through the forest.

name: Legion
description:
Legion is a new skill and strategy game. It has 81 unique playing tiles and is played on a 9x9 board with 81 squares. each playing tile is square, and has either two, one or no stripes marked on each side.

Players have seven tiles and take turns to form lines of tiles on the board. After a turn, a player replenishes his seven tiles from the tile bag. Each side of every tile played must match the sides of every tile already on the board that it touches. Pieces score 1 if played onto a white square. The board has a grid of bonus squares. Pieces played onto bonus squares score the number of stripes on the piece played times 2 (blue), 3 (silver), or 5 (gold). Each tile has a red dot on one face, and must be played with this side facing the red dot on the board. The game ends when no player can place any more of their tiles on the board. the number of stripes on pieces still held by each player is deducted from their score at the end of the game. The player with the most points wins.

name: Trail of the Brotherhood
description:
Trail of the Brotherhood is an adventure game with a deductive element set in the world of H.P. Lovecraft in the 1920s as the Investigative player teams work as a group to discover the Old One the Sorcerer players is working to summon. In a race against time the Investigators will span the globe seeking to uncover clues, attacking cults that have joined The Brotherhood, and working to obtain the keystone magical item required for the final ceremony. Will they succeed in this desperate quest, or will the Sorcerer player prevail, joining cults together to create the ritual’s power while wielding the required magic item to open the gate and wake the Old One they worship from slumber?
Trail of the Brotherhood is a game for 2 – 5 players designed by Richard Launius and published by EOS.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Novel-based

name: Zoo Train
description:
From the publisher:

Sixteen felt pieces that when put together make a train of zoo animals. The body parts are the same size so a child can create some new kinds of funny animals! If a friend comes over or if it's a Birthday Party, rules are included for using the puzzle as a Group Co-op Game.

name: Codswallop
description:
CONTENTS

1 Codswallop Console
258 Codswallop description cards
6 Joker Cards
50 Wallop tiddlywinks
6 Yes/No Vote Cards

Object:

Simply put down description cards on the playing console, in turns, across a row or down a column to build a profile of almost anything! But beware of bluffing, because you may be "Codswalloped" and called on to name your object.

When 3 cards have been played on a line, shout the word they described and claim the points.
categories: Bluffing, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game

name: Music Box
description: Music Boxx is a memory game to help teach players how to read music. Cards have bass and treble clefs, and players attempt to match these with their playing boards appropriate notes. The game may be adjusted in difficulty to accommodate growing abilities. Ages 5 and up

name: Music Snap
description: A unique deck of cards designed to teach children musical concepts using snaps and pairs. Includes a self-checking guide. Ages 5 and up

name: Cold Feet
description: The Squirt Game! A very unusual game that has a water gun attached to the game board. Spin the spinner on the game board and fire the water gun, but it only fires once or twice out of every six trigger pulls. Players start the game with 5 tokens. Trade in small water drip tokens to avoid getting shot and collect tokens when the trigger is pulled but does not fire. Tokens are small, medium and large sized plastic "water drops." Trade in 5 small tokens for a medium token. Trade in 2 medium tokens for a large token and win the game by trading in 2 large tokens for the "Big Shot" button. Just the game we want to play in a room filled with cardboard game boxes!

name: Tell the Time Snap
description: This unique deck of cards uses snaps and pairs to teach children various concepts of time. Features include a 24 hour clock, digital clock, roman clock face, a.m. and p.m., etc... Ages 4 and up

name: Dispatch: The Airport Strategy Game
description: The aim of the game is for players to get all aircraft into the airport and airborne again as quickly as possible to beat the other players.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Skillcat: The Nine Lives Card Game
description:
Trick taking card game (capture a specific amount),with new scoring system ( 1st-4th place in bid accuracy). No more great cards dealt determining winner here, as each player has control over his own scoring. Each player has 9 lives to begin game,if you lose them all you are replaced by a Computer player and game continues. (internet version) Game play is 6-12 hands, approx.20-40 minutes
CP has exact rules of play. Game has 6 tie-breakers, as scoring is close (12-10-8-6)Also has a"halo" rule. Game is singles play, no partnerships, spades always trump suit. web add is www.skillcat.com

name: Legends of Syrrith
description:
From the publisher's website:

Legends of Syrrith is a boardgame for up to 4 players, with playing time usually being 1-2 hours. The boardgame can be played solitaire, as a group or you can compete against other players.

In solitaire and competition mode players start the game with a single hero, one henchmen and a small amount of gold. When played as a group each player chooses a hero that they wish to control and the group works as a team to accomplish missions and encounters.

As heroes explore Syrrith they will gain powerful items, treasure and additional heroes to join their group. With over 30 heroes and henchmen to pick from, not to mention over 100 different monsters, traps, dungeons and encounters each game will always be interesting. As each players group grows in power they will be able to take on stronger opponents and harder dungeons.

Legends of Syrrith can be played by itself as a full stand alone game or it can even be used with the Shadow Wars boardgame. When used with the Shadow Wars boardgame, this expansion takes on a whole new twist. Many Heroes can be used in your armies and the items that your adventurers find are useful in your goal to conquer Syrrith. Heroic warriors, arcane wizards, crafty rogues and ancient items of power will be at your command.
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Knight Works, LLC

name: Earth One
description:
The object of Earth One is to be the first to to complete one complete suit.

The deck consists of 60 hexagonal cards, 12 of each suit (colour), 1 wildcard (Starbender) and 11 purchase cards (Zambuk). Each suit consists of one Level 1 card (Hexrex), 2 level 2 cards (Commander and Chancellor), 4 level 3 cards (Skyrine) and 5 level 4 cards (Dade).

To win, a player must table the Hexrex, Commander, Chancellor, 3 Skyrine's and 4 Dade's of the same colour.

name: Busted
description:
From the game box:
BUSTED is a game about selling marijuana on the streets. A player will find himself in a situation similar to that of a marijuana dealer.

Day of Destiny

When each player reaches the end of his dealing career, his destiny will either be death, because of bad money management; the Slammer, because of his bad luck; or Marijuana Mountain because of his good fortune in dealing. The last remaining dealer in the game will automatically go to Marijuana Mountain. Mr. Big feels that you've learned a lesson from all the players and will allow you to turn in all your money and marijuana and go to the Mountain alive.

name: Hot Matches
description: A 49 card deck is shuffled and arranged in six rows of eight cards with the last row having a ninth card. Players turn over two cards and if they match, the player must follow the instructions on the card. When a match is made, the same player goes again. If there is no match, turn the cards over and play proceeds to the next clockwise player until one card remains. The winner is determined by the player with the most clothing on and the biggest smile on their face.

name: Dirty Dare
description: Each player rolls the dice and moves around the board landing on one of the four Dirty Dare categories, Physical (e.g. pretend to have a facial tic continuously for one minute), Messy e.g. while the player on your left sprinkles flour over your head you must sing a song), Entertaining (e.g. make up a rap song about your mother) or Hot (e.g. for 30 seconds, seduce the player of the opposite sex on your right.) A Dirty Dare card of the same category is drawn and a sand timer is started. The player has until the timer runs out to decide if they are going to complete the dare or pass the card. If the card is passed all the way around to the player that initially passed, that player must draw a new card and perform the dare without the option to pass. Players completing a dare to the satisfaction of the other players, get a check mark for that category on their score sheet. If the dare was passed to another player that completes the dare, that player receives a check mark and the player that passed the dare loses a check mark in the same category. The winner is the first player to complete 2 dares in each of the four categories.

name: Grab the Green
description:
From the rules: In the truest form of capitalism the object of this game is to make the most money. You make money by paying the going rate for each green and then turning the green for a profit in designated cities. He with the most in the end wins.

A "Monopoly"-like game that allows bankrupt players back in the game. Since the rules provide for no end or winning conditions, players should set a time or money limit.

Game was limited to a print run of 500.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Escapades
description: An adult charades games with a risque flavor. Colored chips with 1 through 12 are selected to create teams. Men draw from red chips, women from white. First couple chooses the top card to act out. Points are scored by having the other players guess the Escapade. The faster others guess your charade, the more points you score. If the Escapade is not guessed within 7 minutes, no points are scored and the next couple picks an Escapade card and begins. The first team to score 15 points wins.

name: Foreplaying Dart Game
description: Four dart balls with velcro are tossed at the dart board and players must follow the directions on the space hit. Space are marked with clothing that must be removed, kisses or massages. When one of the players is naked, the winner is the player with the most clothing.

name: X-Rated Trivia
description:
OBJECT OF THE GAME: To collect as many Body Part cards as you can by answering the questions correctly, so that you can create 'whole' men and women.

THE CARDS - each card has multiple choice questions (with their answers marked by an asterix*) on one side and a part of a body on the other. To collect a whole man or woman you will need four cards. There are three different types of women to collect.

The game features a push your luck system where if you answer the first question correctly you keep the card or you can request the second question, which if correctly you keep the card and swap two cards with another player (who has no right of refusal), finally you can request the third question which if answered correctly you get to keep the card and steal two cards from another player.

The Winner is the player with the most completed men and women once all the cards have been used

name: Beau Monde
description: A card-based game of war with 4 sets of 14 cards each. Obviously hand management is critical.

name: Hampshire
description:
Hampshire is a word game made in Littleton, New Hampshire (USA) - hence the name. The game comes with four dice (red, blue, green, purple), two player letter charts (in color), rules, and a pad of score sheets (which contain simply 25 blank squares in a 5x5 grid). The whole thing fits in a box 3" x 3" x 2" (7.5 cm x 7.5 cm x 5 cm) and so is touted as being "for home or travel."

Each turn you roll all four dice and consult the letter chart. The chart shows a result from 1-5 for each of the four colors. The twenty spaces contain the twenty consonants (all except "Y"). So a roll of 4 on the blue die gives a "T" result, for example.

If the player rolls no 6s, he must choose one of the consonants rolled and enter it anywhere he wants in the 5x5 score sheet. If he rolled at least one 6, he may also enter a vowel (or "Y") of his choice. If the red and green dice = 7, he may use the purple and blue dice as normal (choose one consonant from the blue and purple rows) but may then add a second consonant of his choice.

The letter(s) chosen must be entered onto the score sheet - there is only one score sheet for both players, passed back and forth each turn. Basic Scrabble rules are followed in the mini 5x5 board. Every letter placed must be alone or make a word. You score one point for each word you make. First player to nine points wins. When the score sheet is full or unusable, if no one has reached nine points, start a new score sheet.

name: Gunpowder Treason
description:
The perfect game to play November 5, Gunpowder Treason is a game based on Guy Fawkes' attempt to blow up Parliament in 1605. This in itself is a little spooky, but what's really spooky is that the box says that Aztral Games designed it for Astra Fireworks Company in the UK!

It's a fairly simple game: move one space on your turn and possibly draw a card. The object is to be the first to get your four barrels of gunpowder at the edges of the board to Parliament at the center of the board - you can only carry one at a time. The board has lots of squares, some with text on them and some with tunnels for faster (but riskier) movement.

About a fifth of the spaces are of each player color, and the other fifth are white. If you end your turn on a white space or your own color, your turn is over. If you end on another color, draw a card. These range from being good for you ("Take another turn") to potentially bad for you or even for an opponent ("Counterinsurgency agents raid ...").

Sometimes games end with Parliament being blown up, but more often one player simply has the last uncaptured piece on the board. This is actually kind of reassuring, in a real-world sense.

name: Numbers Count
description: This innovative game will help your child to develop critical thinking and problem solving--important math skills to have at any time of the year. This game was developed by a Kindergarten teacher and a speech-language pathologist. Players flip over a secret number card, listen for clues and use the arrows to uncover the secret number. You’ve got three chances to find a strategy and win the secret target. You can play ‘Double Digit Duo’ and arrange the cards to make the largest double digit number possible. You can play ‘Secret Memory’ and be the first to claim the most matching number cards. Multi-level play variations include skill building games, 44 self correcting double sided puzzle pieces, 42 secret number cards, 21 English and Spanish word cards and 22 wiggly arrows.

name: Zominoes
description: Object of play is to build a structure that touches down on your opponent's side of the barrier wall. Tiles are drawn from the tile dispenser for play. Tiles may be held, but some must be played immediately. To win, a players must build so that one of their tiles touches down on the opponent's side of the barrier wall, or force the opposing player to build so that one of his own tiles touches down in their own side of the wall.

name: Tik-Tak3
description: Three-dimensional fast frantic party games. Multi-dimensional fun that is highly contagious! The easiest game embodies the ancient rule of placing objects-in-a-row on any level of dimension while preventing other players from doing the same. What is new is the combination of multiple players and dimensions. You can play Tik-Tak3 at different levels from very easy to very complex.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Educational, Party Game, Word Game

name: Lex Complex
description:
A German trivia game for law students and lawyers.

Theme
The game contains 2,500 questions and cases from the areas of civil, criminal and public law on 1,000 cards.

Goal
Before the game, players agree on a number of chips to be collected. The first player to collect that number of chips wins the game.

Game play
Players move their tokens on a course on the board and, according to which type of space they land on, have to answer trivia questions or argue a case. In the cases, players have to take on different roles - sometimes, they have to act as a defender, sometimes as a prosecutor or judge.
The course also contains event and risk spaces and others that challenge the players' memory. A player who successfully answers a question or completes a task earns a chip.
The game ends when a player has collected a previously agreed upon number of chips.

name: Zwergenkrönlein
description: Little dwarfs sailing in little nut shells. There are tiles with little nut shells. Under these tiles are signs and you have to find matching signs.

name: Detektiv Spürnase
description:
The first player takes the plasticine and rolls it to a ball. After that the player makes the plasticine flat and chooses an animal figure. The player pushes the figure or a part of it into the plasticine. It's allowed to puch only the ears or head into the plasticine. Than he/she passes the plasticine to the next player.
The second player may choose an animal figure and try if it fits in the plasticine. When it fits that player keeps the figure.
The next player makes a new imprint. If it doesn't fit the next player chooses a figure and looks of it fits in the plasticine.
The game ends when a player has collected 3 animals.

name: Breeders: The Assault
description:
Tensions escalate from border skirmishes to a full-fledged war in Breeders: The Assault, the continuation of the saga introduced in Breeders: Initial Contact! B:TA picks up where B:IC left off, and features a larger map, color components, and expanded rules to handle equipment repair, computer operation, random Breeder mutations, and more. Plus, all new scenarios!

Game components: 12 page rulebook, 1 quick sheet, 13" x 10" game map, 189 full-color unit counters.

Designed by Carl Forhan, illustrated by DJAR.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: Igelrennen
description: There are different dices in this game. The ones who roll high numbers cost more out of our food reserve. The food reserve is limited.

name: Alles dreht sich um die Wilde Wiese
description: Rudi Raser wants to mow his lawn. The players try to disturb him because he uses stuff that is bad for the environment.

name: Advance
description: Advance armies consist of a General, 2 Colonels, 2 Majors, 2 Captains and 8 Soldiers with different movements. Win by advancing your General into the opponent's General Headquarters or by out-maneuvering the opponent's General.

name: Magical Mitzvah Park
description:
This carnival-themed boardgame from Jewish Educational Toys employs simple spinner roll-and-move mechanics to move children through the theme park past the Mt. Sinai Express and the Red Sea Treasure Hunt. Players spin and move to the next square of the color indicated. Additionally, players may collect tickets when the spinner lands on the "Tickets" option, and then spend the tickets to take shortcuts through the rides when they land on the appropriate squares.
Recommended for Ages 4 - 8.

name: Thirty Three
description:
Thirty Three is a game of chance requiring the power of observation & strategy. Using 4 dice there are 33 different number combinations to be scored. The object of the game is to score as many of these combinations as possible, in such a way as to score bonus points.
The combinations are scored in 11 houses of 3, and arranged in a circle of 22 houses (2 of each) on the playing board.
Each player may role one or more of their dice, up to four times during their turn. A player may stop at any time and score a combination point by playing one of their playing pieces on the appropriate place in the circle of houses.
If by the end of a turn the player has not scored, the player must place one playing piece in the center of the board and deduct one point from their score at the end of the game.
The game ends when there are the same number of pieces in the center as there are places left unscored in the circle of houses.

name: Risque
description: A booklet of sixty sexy situations in cartoon form with sample captions and a rules sheet. Host selects a cartoon at random and players have three minutes to think up and write down a humorous caption that fits the risque setting. Players earn fifteen points for the agreed upon best caption, ten points for the second best and five points for third. Play continues for a predetermined number of rounds with the high scorer winning.

name: Over the Hill Sex Game
description: A huge board with many rooms and a die with faces: Try Again, Massage, Toys, Lotions & Potions, Solo and Fantasy. Roll the die on the board, go to that room and perform the roll for two minutes.

name: CityProGame Zurich
description: Establish 5 businesses in the city of Zurich. Includes board, 80 cards,8 counters, and 3 dice.

name: Tacticube
description:
Tacticube is a set of games played on an unusual board, namely a cube with a 3x3 array of holes on each side. Players insert pegs into the holes to play. The set includes a stand which allows the cube to stand on one corner.

The five games are

Qbacheck, a checkers-like jumping game.

Go-Mo-Cube, Go-Moku on a cube.

Cubic Tic-Tac-Toe, in which the object is to get three pegs in a row, all on different faces of the cube.

The Mill on the Cube, Nine Men's Morris on a cube.

Cubic Chinese Checkers, which is as you'd expect. This is the only game for more than 2 players.
publishers: Great Games, Inc., Samuel Ward Co.

name: Scatter
description:
The object of the game is to get one playing piece on each of the eight movable tiles.
The eight movable tiles are arranged in a square pattern in the playing box, leaving the center space open. Each player receives eight playing pieces of the same color which are arranged on the movable tiles in a symmetrical pattern. To play the game:
In his/her turn a player can do one of two things:
1. Move one of his/her playing pieces.
2. Move any one of the movable tiles.
A playing piece can be moved forward, backward, left, or right to an adjacent vacant hole in a tile. Diagonal moves are not allowed. A playing piece may not jump over another playing piece.
A tile can be moved by sliding it into the vacant space, vertically or horizontally. A player can move a tile regardless of whether he/she has a playing piece on that particular tile.
The two players alternate turns moving one playing piece or one movable tile. The first player to succeed in getting one of his/her eight playing pieces on each of the eight tiles at the same time wins the game.

name: Sombrero
description:
This game is played on a 8x8 square board
TURN - On each turn, each player makes two moves. He can choose (in any order) between: Move one of his Kings to an adjacent (orthogonal or diagonal) empty cell. If a move creates a straight line (orthogonal or diagonal) of enemy stones with two friendly Kings on the edges, the enemy stones are demoted to soldiers (this is a kind of extended custodian capture).
Captures are not mandatory.
Swap one King with one adjacent friendly soldier.
GOAL - Wins the player that demotes all but one of the enemy Kings. If both players only have 2 Kings left, and after 20 moves there are no more captures, the game is a draw.

name: Anglethon
description:
Ages 7 and up

A game for 2 to 6 players and no fishy questions to answer!

This dice game is easy to play, with 5 ways to play it offers good value. Whilst teaching mathematics and environmental issues, Anglethon is a game of chance for everyone. Game time is about an hour.

name: The National Game of Peace for Our Nation
description: Munich appeasement-era game using a desk of cards, a board and lots of red wooden counters.

name: Let's Play Tag
description:
Let's Play Tag simulates the classic children game of Tag on a board.

Players choose their own playing pieces and one of them (he or she who spins the lowest number) becomes "It". The "It" sets aside his or her piece and uses the "It" arrow-shaped marker instead, placing it in the central Safety Zone. The other players start off in the red squares marked with S. The players take turns to play, spinning the dial twice to obtain the number of moves they can make. Players can move their pieces in any direction; "It", however, must move in the direction of its arrow until it reaches a red square, whereupon it can turn in any direction.

If "It" lands on a player's piece, that player becomes "It", exchanging his or her piece for the marker; the former "It" takes back his piece and starts in the Safety Zone. If a player's piece lands onto "It"'s rear from behind, he or she scores 10 points. Nobody can become "It" or score points in the Safety Zone.

The game ends when a player scores a total of 50 points and is declared the winner.

name: Max's Attic
description: Join Max in an attic full of weird and wonderful stuff! Be the first player to put all of your cards in the attic by matching long and short vowel sounds. Includes 17" x 12" game board, 24 cards and spinner. For Ages 6 - 8.

name: DHL Worldwide Express Game
description:
This appears to be a promotional game distributed to DHL employees and/or customers (probably employees).

The game is played in two phases. In the first phase you move your DHL van around a track on the outside of the board (via die roll). You can get Dispatch (event) cards and Shipment cards. When you have five of the latter you have to get your van to an airport space, and you then fly your plane along the air routes in the middle of the board, trying to get to your five destination airports.

You can in theory go back to the airport where you left your van and start moving that again - the reason to do this would be to try to pick up Dispatch cards that set your clock back. Each player has a cardboard dial on which they count up to 24 hours. Cards can tell you to add or subtract hours, and every turn you move your plane takes an hour. If you reach 24 hours without having made all your deliveries you automatically lose.

name: Game Board Book: Phonics
description: Perfect for small group learning and center activities, each of these unique books includes everything needed for 2-4 children to play six different games. Each game Reinforces skills through play and promotes interaction and cooperation. Each book contains: 6 fun, removable, full-color game boards, spinners, playing pieces and storage. Games include: Rhyme Frenzy, Whirl-A-Vowel, Spelling Bee, Leaping Letters, Word Construction, and Blend Squares. For ages 6 to 12.

name: Game Board Book: Time and Money
description: Perfect for small group learning and center activities, each of these unique books includes everything needed for 2-4 children to play six different games. Each game Reinforces skills through play and promotes interaction and cooperation. Each book contains: 6 fun, removable, full-color game boards, spinners, playing pieces and storage. Games include: Telling Time Tales, Time Flies, Coin Cleanup, Watch Dog, Sherlock Hog’s, Coin Mysteries, and Sidewalk Sale. For ages 6 to 12.

name: Game Board Book: Addition and Subtraction
description: Perfect for small group learning and center activities, each of these unique books includes everything needed for 2-4 children to play six different games. Each game Reinforces skills through play and promotes interaction and cooperation. Each book contains: 6 fun, removable, full-color game boards, spinners, playing pieces and storage. Games include: Spider Math, Operation Station, Treasure Math, Subtraction Pond, Undersea Addition & Subtraction, and Math Express

name: Crossword Toss
description: Step right up and learn to read! Reinforce letter recognition, word building and reading skills with this fast-paced game. Players take turns rolling consonant and vowel cubes to form words. Every letter used in a word is a chance to win points and prizes by tossing it into the plastic buckets. The player with the most points wins. Pre-assembled for easy setup this pop-up game measures 20" L x 10" W x 111/2" H. Age 6 - 12.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game

name: Chice
description:
"Play Chancy Chess with Chice"

Chice is a chess variant that uses two dice (called chice just one is a "chi"). The dice have faces with various chess pieces. After each player makes an opening move, they each roll both chice on their turn. You must move one of your chess pieces as shown on the chice (your choice of which). No legal move? You lose your turn. Roll doubles, you can move the same piece twice or make one move each with two different men (for example, both rooks). Roll double kings, and move your king like a queen!

name: CardSen$e
description:
From Pagat:

This is a card game in the Barbu family. It uses a standard deck and has four subgames (Queen of Spades, Last 2, Tricks and FanTan).

Queen of Spades: the object is to avoid taking the Queen of Spades. Players who win a trick on which the QoS is played pays the bank $100.

Last 2: Avoid winning the next-to-last and the last tricks. The player who takes next-to-last trick pays $50 to bank; Player who takes the last trick pays $100 to bank.

Tricks: The banker gives the appropriately marked chip to the winner of each trick. At the completion of play, each player adds the numbers on his chips and multiplies this total by $10. This dollar amount is what the player receives from the bank. For example, if a player wins the 1st, 4th, and 11th tricks, then he would receive $160 from the bank (1+4+11 = 16 x $10 = $160). The 1st trick is worth $10; $20 for 2nd; $30 for 3rd; etc.

FanTan: Play all of one's cards before any other player can play all of his. The bank pays $100 to the player which is the 1st Out; Bank pays $50 to 2nd Out; 3rd Out receives nothing and pays nothing; 4th Out pays $50 to bank; 5th Out pays $75 to bank; 6th Out pays $100 to bank; 7th Out pays $125 to bank; 8th Out pays $150 to bank.

name: Quads
description:
From the box:

Quads - A Novel Game of Tactics

Quads is Cunning Tactics, Skill and Strategy! But mostly, Quads is Great Fun!

Other notes:

This game was self-published by the designer.

name: Tricky Trash Truck
description: Be the first player to clean up all the trash in your yard. One of the players winds the truck placing it in the street in any direction and letting it go. When the truck is in a player’s street, that player may place, as fast as he can, and only one at a time, pieces of trash from his yard into the truck. Each player does the same when the truck is on his street. When the truck winds down and stops on a street, the player owning that street unloads all the trash from the truck into his yard. He then winds the truck and play is ready to begin again. The first player to load the truck with all the trash form his yard is the winner—provided the truck does not stop on his street on that turn.

name: SI, the Sporting Word Game
description:
SI, the Sporting Word Game, was published by Parker Bros. for Sports Illustrated. The game comes with 30 letter dice (a la Scribbage), 14 cards and a shaker. Each card shows a different sport, with an illustration of the sport plus bonus words.

The letters have no numbers on them, just one letter per side. You spell words and must join them like a crossword puzzle. All words have to relate to the sport on the card turned over for you or they don't score. Otherwise, use basic Scrabble rules for word creation. They give you hints on how to find words (participants in the sport, equipment used, scoring terms, setting, special language). A turn is a maximum of five minutes.

You get one point for each cube you use, double that for bonus words, and a 25-point bonus if you use all 30 dice. First player or team to 200 points wins.

name: Hoppity Hooper Game
description: In this game, Hoppity Hooper, the cute T.V. Frog, and Professor Waldo Wigglesworth, the clever rascal, try to catch each other as they hop around the board. One Player has seven playing Disks with the “Professor’s” picture, and his Opponent has seven Disks with “Hoppity’s” picture. On the under side of each Disk is a Number—either a 1, 2, or 3—which is hidden during the game. The Number tells the Player how many spaces the Disk must be moved. If a Player can land one of his Disks, by exact count, on top of an Opponent’s Disk, the Opponent’s Disk is captured and removed from the game. The Spinner tells the Player which Numbered Disk he can move . . . but . . . since the Numbers are hidden, the Player must remember where on of his Disks of that Number is located. The object of the game is to be the first to capture all but one of your Opponent’s Disks.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Monkey Swing
description: Too many bananas make this monkey tumble off the tree! On your turn place one of the bananas on this tilting monkey . . . Some can hang from his arms and legs and tail. Others can be put—carefully now!—across his hands and feet. It’s a bunch of fun as he spins and tips. But, when you give him one banana too many, the whole bunch—and the monkey—can fall. The player that brings them down must keep all the bananas that fell, then put the monkey back on top for another round of play. The first player to have no bananas left is the top banana!

name: Landships! Tactical Weapons Innovations 1914-1918: Real Weapons
description:
REAL WEAPONS will be the final module in the award winning Landships! design. Unlike the first two, Real Weapons focuses on the major developments in war technology from 1936-41. During this small slice of time, major technological changes occurred to tanks and aircraft. This module will use the maps from both Landships! and Infernal Machines, but adds an additional 200+ counters (covering the BF109, Ju87, HEIII, T26B, BT5, BA 10, CV35, T34A, Pz I, PzIl, and PzIll to name but a few new weapons), a map section of its own, and new rules to cover the new technology. The game system uses a new, more intricate system to simulate modern aircraft and armor.

The scenarios, like in the previous games, are the heart of the matter. Like its predecessor, they are based on historical battles. Here, for the first time, the Spanish Civil War receives a long-overdue focus, with numerous scenarios involving tanks and the dreaded 88L56 multipurpose gun. Also covered are: The Finnish War; Zhukov in the Far East; the first encounters of the Germans with the KV-1 and T34A in 1941; the French in 1940 Indochina,; the Campaign for France in 1940; and Panzers in Norway.

Contents:

1 double sided 11 x 17 geomorphic map
1 color countersheet containing 280 counters
historical commentary
scenarios and expansion rules


(from COA website)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: The Big Sneeze
description: The object of the game is to build houses of cards. The game has a "Big Sneezer", a plastic unit with an hand powered air pump inside. Cards are played to build with one, two or three cards, to use the Big Sneezer to try and knock over your opponents house of cards or a stop cards that prevents other players from blowing on your house or prevents other players from building. The winner is the first to build a house six stories tall.

name: Radio Game
description:
The inside of the box lid on one version states the rules for four different game variants. The common theme is trying to broadcast messages on various radio stations.

On the game board is a stylized map of the United States, indicating the boundaries of each state. The map is in four colors, and each color indicates a time zone:

red: Pacific Time
green: Mountain Time
grey: Central Time
yellow: Eastern Time


Circles across the map are joined by red and blue lines, to indicate the two dominant national radio networks, NBC Red and NBC Blue. These lines are the tracks for movement of the players' circular cardboard counters.

A spinner is used by the players to determine their movement around the board. A metal arrow in the center of the card is spun by a player to determine their move. The outer circle on the card is divided into the four US time zones. Within each zone are the numbers 1, 2, and 3, indicating the number of spaces to move.

Several versions of this game have been manufactured, including by Milton Bradley.

name: Alley Oop
description:
Alley Oop was a popular North American newspaper cartoon strip during the 1920s, 30s, 40s and beyond.

The game comes in a cardboard 'can' container with tin lids. The drumstick-like pieces in the game are elongated round wooden bulbs attached to wooden sticks. There are four of each color used in the game. They are the stylized clubs used by "Alley" and his friends in the cartoon, and are known as "Oops". The lever-like pieces are also made of wood. Each of these pieces are placed on a table, pointed side down, and with a "see-saw" movement can propel an "Oop".

The idea of the game is to place the head of an OOP over the groove in the FLIPPER then strike the FLIPPER downward, thereby sending the OOP into the air and (you hope) into the CAN.

Game consists of:

3 OOPS in each of four colors, Green, Yellow, Blue and Red OOPS
1 Black OOP (Foozy)
4 Colored Flippers (colored as OOPS)
CAN.
Instruction Sheet


Each OOP, according to color, represents a different value. GREEN - 1 Point, YELLOW - 2, BLUE - 3 Points, RED - 4, BLACK (Foozy) - 5 Points.

name: Clock-A-Word
description: Plastic toy combining a timer and a one-armed-bandit which shuffles 9 letters, which you then use to find the longest word before the timer runs out.

name: Hip-Hip Hooray
description: You'll have loads of fun playing this hilarious board game that will have you performing charades, drawing pictures, and just plain acting silly. Points are earned by performing these tasks as found on activity cards along the way. Be the first to collect 44 points and you win the game. Ages 7 and up

name: Manchester Games
description:
8 different games, using a board which represents Greater Manchester (England), in as much as each of the spaces is named after a Greater Manchester place name and the positions are approximately related to geography. Wigan borough place names have been excluded presumably because it upsets the symmetry of the board.
As well as the board, the games use counters, different colour skittle pieces. Some of the games use a die and/or cards.
The rules to each game are brief (one A5 sheet or less) and simple. They have varying degrees of tactical scope. Some are race games but most are abstract strategies. The main appeal is the use of local names, assuming that the player is 'local'.

Some of the games use a random element in the piece set up (by drawing place name cards), some of the games use a random element in the movement allowance. Only one game, Werneth, has no random element.

The limits in the number of players for each game seems to be more a function of the pieces issued rather than game balance. There would seem to be scope for adding players if extra pieces were drafted in from another game.

ANCOATS (2-6 players) is a movement game. Ability to move depends on the colour of the card drawn, the colour of the space the piece is on and the colour it is moving to. The winner is the first player to land on the three places determined by a random selection of three cards at the start of the game.

BURNAGE (2-6 players) a movement game collecting cards at each space visited, or challenging other players for the cards they have collected. The winner being the first to collect a predetermined number of cards.
